original: gong du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan smos te /
analyzed: gong du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan smos te /
translated: The above mentions the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbyin gnas su gyur pa bstan pa dang / de ltar sbyin gnas su gyur pa de dag la mchod cing yon phul na 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbyin gnas su gyur pa bstan pa dang / de ltar sbyin gnas su gyur pa de dag la mchod cing yon phul na 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: It shows that the bodhisattvas who have such qualities become the objects of giving for the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and it asks whether or not a great result will come from making offerings and giving gifts to those who have become objects of giving in that way.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni sbyin pa'i rnam grangs kyis yongs su sbyong ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni sbyin pa'i rnam grangs kyis yongs su sbyong ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, the bodhisattva great beings purify by the enumeration of giving.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu tshe rabs phyi ma la rnam par smin pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu tshe rabs phyi ma la rnam par smin pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the result of giving will be a great ripening in future lives.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la sbyin pa byin na ni kun kyang shin tu dag pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la sbyin pa byin na ni kun kyang shin tu dag pa ste /
translated: When one gives to the bodhisattva great beings, all is very pure.

original: de yang 'di ltar sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it is like this, O Śāriputra, the bodhisattva, the great being, gives gifts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin ba byin pa tshe rabs phyi ma la yongs su sbyong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin ba byin pa tshe rabs phyi ma la yongs su sbyong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason for the purification of giving in future lives.

original: sbyin pa byin pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyin ba yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyin ba yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the attainment of many kinds of mundane and supramundane virtuous dharmas as the result of giving, it is called the purification of giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin ba byas pa'i 'bras bu dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin ba byas pa'i 'bras bu dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those many kinds of virtuous dharmas that are attained as the result of giving to the bodhisattva?

original: 'di ltar dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is like this: the paths of the ten wholesome actions, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: the giving of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: de yan chad kyis ji ltar brtson bar bya ba bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ji ltar brtson bar bya ba bstan zin to //
translated: Up to this point, it has been shown how one should strive.

original: de ltar ji ltar brtson bar bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar brtson bar bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown how one should strive,

original: da ni brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan @58a * //
analyzed: da ni brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan @58a * //
translated: now, in order to teach the characteristics of those who strive,

original: pa'i phyir / gsol pa /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / gsol pa /
translated: he says:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyis na brtson zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyis na brtson zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva strive in the perfection of wisdom in order to be called 'one who strives'?

original: ji ltar brtson par bgyis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par chud ces zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brtson par bgyis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par chud ces zhus pa'o //
translated: He asks, How should one strive in order to be considered one who strives in the perfection of wisdom?🔽Śāradvatīputra, here, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva strives in the emptiness of form, he is called 'one who strives.'

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: and so on teaches the characteristics of those who strive.

original: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang ; khams bco brgyad dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcu gnyis dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams snyong pa nyid la brtson par byed na brtson par chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang ; khams bco brgyad dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcu gnyis dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams snyong pa nyid la brtson par byed na brtson par chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, the eighteen elements, the four noble truths, the twelve links of dependent origination, and conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, then one is said to be striving. This is the meaning.

original: de la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams smos pa ni /
analyzed: de la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams smos pa ni /
translated: Here, the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, truths, and dependent origination are mentioned.

original: phung po la sogs pa so so'i mtshan nyid bye brag tu phye ste stong pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa so so'i mtshan nyid bye brag tu phye ste stong pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The emptiness of each aggregate, etc. is taught by distinguishing their individual characteristics.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos gang ji snyed ming du gdags su yod ces bya ba dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad spyir bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos gang ji snyed ming du gdags su yod ces bya ba dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad spyir bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: As for whatever conditioned and unconditioned phenomena there are, to the extent that they can be designated by names, and the emptiness of inherent nature, this is the teaching on the emptiness of the general characteristics of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One is called diligent if one is diligent in these seven kinds of emptiness.

original: phung po dang / khams la sogs pa so sor phye ba bdun po la bya'o //🔽de stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed kyang brtson zhe'am /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams la sogs pa so sor phye ba bdun po la bya'o // de stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed kyang brtson zhe'am /
translated: This refers to the seven kinds of distinctions, such as the aggregates and the elements.🔽 Even if one is diligent in the perfection of wisdom through these seven kinds of emptiness, one should not say diligent or not diligent.

original: mi brtson zhes mi brjod de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi brtson zhes mi brjod de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: de ltar brtson pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan na brtson par byed pa de lta bu don dam par dngos po yod do snyam du rtogs pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan na brtson par byed pa de lta bu don dam par dngos po yod do snyam du rtogs pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: if the characteristic of those who are diligent in that way is taught, that kind of diligence is the opposite of the realization that ultimately things exist.

original: de ltar brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad tsam du bstan du zad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad tsam du bstan du zad kyi /
translated: Even if the characteristic of those who are diligent in that way is taught, it is merely taught as a conventional designation.

original: don dam par mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir brtson zhes bya ba'am mi brtson zhes bya bar brjod du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir brtson zhes bya ba'am mi brtson zhes bya bar brjod du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because ultimately the characteristic is not established, it is taught that one should not say diligent or not diligent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des gzugs brtson zhes bya ba'am mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par @58b rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar des gzugs brtson zhes bya ba'am mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par @58b rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa bstan te /
translated: This shows that ultimately the characteristics are not perceived.

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa so so'i bye brag gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dang rnam pa bzhis stong pa nyid la spyod na brtson par chud do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa so so'i bye brag gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dang rnam pa bzhis stong pa nyid la spyod na brtson par chud do zhes bstan te /
translated: Moreover, if one practices emptiness by means of the four aspects of the non-perception of the individual natures of form and so on, the non-perception of their assembled nature, the non-perception of their own characteristics, and the non-perception of all phenomena, one is said to be striving.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa so so'i bye brag gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas stong ba  nyid la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa so so'i bye brag gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas stong ba  nyid la spyod pa ni /
translated: Here, the practice of emptiness by means of the non-perception of the individual natures of form and so on is as follows.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des gzugs brtson zhes bya ba'am mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar des gzugs brtson zhes bya ba'am mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, he does not see form as either striving or not striving.

original: rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
translated: He does not see consciousness as a phenomenon of affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: or as a phenomenon of purification.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of the identity of the aggregation of phenomena such as form is taught

original: gzugs ni tshor ba dang lhan cig kun du rgyu zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs ni tshor ba dang lhan cig kun du rgyu zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: from “he does not see form moving about together with feeling,” up to

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed dang lhan cig kun du rgyu zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed dang lhan cig kun du rgyu zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: “he does not see consciousness moving about together with volitions.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos gang yang chos gang dang yang lhan cig tu kun du rgyu ba med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos gang yang chos gang dang yang lhan cig tu kun du rgyu ba med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: The reason for the non-apprehension of the identity of the aggregation is taught from “because no phenomenon moves about together with any other phenomenon,” and so on.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi stong ba nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin te 'di ltar gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yang thogs par byed pa med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi stong ba nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin te 'di ltar gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yang thogs par byed pa med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /🔽rnam par shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa bstan to //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste / rnam par shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa bstan to // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin la /🔽stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin la / stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.🔽Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.🔽Thus, the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of form is not form.

original: gang mi skye mi 'gag cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba med /
analyzed: gang mi skye mi 'gag cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba med /
translated: Thus, the

original: rnam par byang  bar 'gyur ba med la mi 'grib mi 'phel te zhes @59a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang  bar 'gyur ba med la mi 'grib mi 'phel te zhes @59a * //
translated: There is no increase or decrease in the unconditioned.

original: bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the reason for the non-apprehension of intrinsic identity is taught.

original: 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: it is not future,🔽it is not present.

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de la ni gzugs med do //
translated: In that, there is no form,

original: tshor ba med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: there is no feeling,

original: de la ni sangs rgyas med do //
analyzed: de la ni sangs rgyas med do //
translated: up to there is no Buddha,🔽there is no enlightenment.

original: byang chub med do zhes bya ba'i bar du chos thams cad dmigs su med pa bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub med do zhes bya ba'i bar du chos thams cad dmigs su med pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the non-apprehension of all dharmas is taught.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this is said to be endeavoring in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa'i mtshan nyid du chud do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa'i mtshan nyid du chud do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, if one practices like this, it is taught that one is included in the definition of one who is endeavoring in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
translated: Thus, although they practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not see it as “striving” in form,

original: gzugs la brtson zhes bya ba'am /🔽mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs de lta bus na /
analyzed: gzugs la brtson zhes bya ba'am / mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs de lta bus na /
translated: or as “not striving” in form.🔽Up to: “Śāradvatī­putra, for these reasons, great bodhisattva beings are said to ‘strive’ in the transcendent perfection of wisdom, because all things are neither conjoined nor disjoined.”

original: chos thams cad 'du ba dang 'bral ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bdag nyid la byed pa por rnam par rtog pa med pa dang
analyzed: chos thams cad 'du ba dang 'bral ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bdag nyid la byed pa por rnam par rtog pa med pa dang
translated: This passage explains that, because they have no concept of themselves as agents,

original: / bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: and because they have no view of a self,

original: bdag nyid la brtson pa'am mi brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid du chud pa rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan to //
analyzed: bdag nyid la brtson pa'am mi brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid du chud pa rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan to //
translated: they have completely abandoned the concept of themselves as striving or not striving. Thus, they are said to “strive” in a different sense, which is the characteristic of striving.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sdud mi 'byed de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sdud mi 'byed de zhes bya ba nas /

translated: They do not combine the emptiness of all things with the emptiness of all things, nor do they discern it.🔽They do not combine the emptiness of specific defining characteristics with the emptiness

analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

translated: Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not engage with the notion that physical forms are permanent,

original: / gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and they do not engage with the notion that physical forms are impermanent, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not engage with the notion that omniscience is permanent,🔽and they do not engage with the notion that omniscience is impermanent.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la /
translated: In this way, with regard to all mundane and supramundane phenomena,🔽some tīrthikas conceive of permanence,

original: mu stegs can kha cig ni rtag par rtog / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mi rtag par rtog ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig ni rtag par rtog / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mi rtag par rtog ste /
translated: and the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas conceive of impermanence.

original: de dag gi mtha' las bzlog pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' las bzlog pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: Because they are the opposite of those, ultimately, since phenomena such as form are not established as existent things,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag ces mi rtog pa nyid la mi sbyor ba zhes bya'o//
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag ces mi rtog pa nyid la mi sbyor ba zhes bya'o//
translated: not conceptualizing them as permanent or impermanent is called “not joining.”

original: @61a * // sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: @61a * // sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs bde'o zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs bde'o zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: they do not join with the idea that form is happiness.

original: gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They do not join with the idea that form is suffering, and so on,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bde'o zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bde'o zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: up to they do not join with the idea that the knowledge of all aspects is happiness.🔽They do not join with the idea that the knowledge of all aspects is suffering.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gzugs la sogs pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gzugs la sogs pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la /
translated: With regard to all mundane and supramundane phenomena such as form,

original: mu stegs can kha cig ni bde bar rtog / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni sdug bsngal du rnam par rtog pa las bzlog pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig ni bde bar rtog / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni sdug bsngal du rnam par rtog pa las bzlog pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: In order to reverse those, it is taught that ultimately all phenomena such as form are not established as existent things,

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal du rtog pa yang mi 'byung ba bstan to //🔽gzugs bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal du rtog pa yang mi 'byung ba bstan to // gzugs bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: and therefore the concepts of happiness and suffering do not occur.🔽Form is not to be conjoined with the self.

original: gzugs bdag med ces bya par mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs bdag med ces bya par mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Form is not to be conjoined with selflessness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: Omniscience is not to be conjoined with the self.🔽Omniscience is not to be conjoined with selflessness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du yang mu stegs can rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bdag yod par rtog /

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni bdag med par rtog ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni bdag med par rtog ste /
translated: Śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas imagine them to be selfless.

original: mtha' de gnyis las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to turn away from those two extremes,

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi gar mi rtog go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi gar mi rtog go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: does not conceive of either a self or selflessness.

original: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply “form is peaceful”

original: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: or “form is not peaceful,” and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: “the knowledge of all aspects is peaceful”🔽or “the knowledge of all aspects is not peaceful.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la zhi ba dang ma zhi ba rnam par rtog pa spangs pas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la zhi ba dang ma zhi ba rnam par rtog pa spangs pas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
translated: This explains the characteristic of striving by abandoning the concepts of peace and not peace in relation to all phenomena such as form and so on.

original: don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por ma grub pas /🔽de dag gi yon tan zhi ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por ma grub pas / de dag gi yon tan zhi ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Because ultimately things such as form are not established,🔽it is impossible to conceive of their qualities as being peaceful

original: ma zhi ba zhes bya bar brtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhi ba zhes bya bar brtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or not peaceful.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One does not apply form is empty

original: mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: or it is not empty.

original: rnam pa thams cad @61b mkhyen pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad @61b mkhyen pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects has wishes or it is without wishes,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i dngos por rtog pa las bzlog ste /🔽stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i dngos po yod par rtog pas kyang mi brtson la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i dngos por rtog pa las bzlog ste / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i dngos po yod par rtog pas kyang mi brtson la /
translated: one turns away from the conception of all phenomena such as form as the entities of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors of liberation.

analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dngos po med par rtog pas kyang mi brtson na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par chud do zhes bstan pa ste / de la gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: If one does not apply oneself to the conception of the entities of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and if one does not apply oneself to the conception of the non-entities of the three doors of liberation, one is said to be applying oneself to the perfection of wisdom.🔽Here, one does not apply 'form is empty'

original: mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: or 'it is not empty.'

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la /🔽stong pa dang mi stong bar rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la / stong pa dang mi stong bar rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from the knowledge of all aspects is empty up to is not empty teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of emptiness, by way of abandoning the concepts of empty and not empty.🔽The passage from form is with signs up to is without signs teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of signlessness, by way of abandoning the concepts of with signs and without signs.

original: gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am /
translated: The passage from form is with wishes up to is without wishes teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of wishlessness, by way of abandoning the concepts of with wishes and without wishes.🔽The passage from form is compounded up to is uncompounded teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of the compounded, by way of abandoning the concepts of compounded and uncompounded.

original: mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from form is surpassable up to is unsurpassable teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of the surpassable, by way of abandoning the concepts of surpassable and unsurpassable.🔽The passage from form is peaceful up to is not peaceful teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of the peaceful, by way of abandoning the concepts of peaceful and not peaceful.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am /🔽mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa la /

translated: The passage from form is empty up to is not empty teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of emptiness, by way of abandoning the concepts of empty and not empty.🔽The passage from form is with signs up to is without signs teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of signlessness, by way of abandoning the concepts of with signs and without signs.

analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa dang mtshan ma med par rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //🔽gzugs smon pa yod ces bya ba'am /🔽smon pa med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from form is with wishes up to is without wishes teaches the defining characteristic of striving in the door of liberation of wishlessness, by way of abandoning the concepts of with wishes and without wishes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba'am /
translated: One does not apply the term existent or

analyzed: smon pa med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa la /

analyzed: smon pa yod pa dang smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //

translated: One does not apply the term arising or ceasing to form, and so on up🔽to One does not apply the term 'arising' or 'ceasing' to the knowledge of

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /

analyzed: mi brtan zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du /
translated: One does not connect it with the words ‘formations’ or ‘not formations.’🔽One does not connect

analyzed: so so'i skye po rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams brtan pa dang snying po yod par lta /
translated: Ordinary people see phenomena such as form as stable and having a core.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mi brtan zhing snying po med pa dang / gsob gsog lta bur lta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mi brtan zhing snying po med pa dang / gsob gsog lta bur lta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir ;
translated: The Listeners and the Self-realized Buddhas are turned away from seeing them as unstable and without a core, as hollow and void.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par mi grub pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par mi grub pas /
translated: Since phenomena such as form are not established as existent things ultimately,🔽their qualities and faults, stability and instability, are also not things.

original: de dag gi yon tan dang / skyon brtan pa dang / mi brtan pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir de lta bur rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /

translated: The defining characteristic of diligence is to be free from such concepts.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽gzugs yod ces bya ba'am /
