translated: This should be applied to all phenomena, from form up to omniscience.

original: med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One does not apply or distinguish form as existent or nonexistent,🔽up to omniscience as existent or nonexistent.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod ces bya ba'am /🔽med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do zhes bya ba'i @62b bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod ces bya ba'am / med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do zhes bya ba'i @62b bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la /
translated: One does not apply or discriminate that the knowledge of all modes exists or does not exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i mthar rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i mthar rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the characteristic of striving is taught by way of abandoning the conceptualization of the extreme of existence and non-existence of phenomena such as form.

original: mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ One does not apply” means

original: yod med kyi mthar rtog pa dang bcas pas brtson par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yod med kyi mthar rtog pa dang bcas pas brtson par mi byed pa'o //
translated: one does not strive with the conceptualization of the extreme of existence and non-existence.

original: mi 'byed ces bya ba ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'byed ces bya ba ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: “ One does not discriminate” means the opposite of that.

original: mi sbyor bar yang mi 'byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi sbyor bar yang mi 'byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not discriminate without applying.

original: kun rdzob tu chos rnams yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid shes par byas nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos rnams yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid shes par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the characteristic of the existence and non-existence of phenomena conventionally,

original: thabs mkhas pas de la ma chags par brtson par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas de la ma chags par brtson par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one must strive without attachment to them through skill in means.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When one practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: one does not apprehend “practice.”

original: mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //🔽spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so // spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: One does not apprehend one does not practice.

original: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One does not apprehend one practices and also does not practice, or one neither practices nor does not practice.

original: spyod pa dang mi spyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /🔽de la spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar spyod cing brtson pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la yang de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: spyod pa dang mi spyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste / de la spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar spyod cing brtson pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la yang de ltar spyod na /
translated: This is the teaching on the defining characteristic of striving in terms of abandoning the four types of conceptualization, such as practice and non-practice.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par chud do zhes mtshan mar yang mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par chud do zhes mtshan mar yang mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Here, one does not apprehend 'one practices' means that even one who possesses the defining characteristic of striving and practicing, as explained above, does not apprehend the defining characteristic of practice as a sign, thinking if one practices in that way, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gong ma las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gong ma las bzlog pa ste /
translated: One does not apprehend one does not practice means the opposite of the above.

original: brtson pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa la yang 'dis spyod pa'am /🔽brtson par mi chud do zhes kyang mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa la yang 'dis spyod pa'am / brtson par mi chud do zhes kyang mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One should not grasp at the sign of the thought, “Even one who does not have the characteristics of striving does not understand that one is practicing or striving through this.”

original: spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽kun rdzob tu mi spyod par yang chud la /
analyzed: spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni / kun rdzob tu mi spyod par yang chud la /
translated: “One does not apprehend even the practice, or even the non-practice, as practice” means

original: don dam par spyod par mi chud do zhes bya ba'i mtshan mar yang mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par spyod par mi chud do zhes bya ba'i mtshan mar yang mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: one does not grasp at the sign of the thought, “Even though one does not practice conventionally,🔽one does not understand that one practices ultimately.”

original: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnam par rtog pa dang po las lta 'og spos pa ste /🔽don dam par spyod pa yang ma yin la ;
analyzed: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni / rnam par rtog pa dang po las lta 'og spos pa ste / don dam par spyod pa yang ma yin la ;
translated: “One does not apprehend even the non-practice, or even the practice, as non-practice” means🔽one does not grasp at the sign of the thought, “Ultimately one does not practice,

original: kun rdzob tu mi spyod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu mi spyod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: and conventionally one does not not practice.”

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa bzhir mi 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa bzhir mi 'jug pa ni /
translated: Not engaging in the four conceptualizations in this way,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa'i mtshan nyid du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @63a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa'i mtshan nyid du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @63a * //
translated: The meaning is that it is included in the definition of striving in the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the perfection of giving, and so on up to

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du /
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the limit of reality.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams tha dad par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /🔽chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid du tha dad pa med pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams tha dad par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste / chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid du tha dad pa med pa la /
translated: This teaches the definition of striving in terms of abandoning the conception of the dharmas such as the perfection of giving as different.

original: tha dad du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable to apprehend as different all dharmas that are not different in the reality of emptiness.

original: de bas na de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Therefore, why is it so?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: chos gang la yang tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang la yang tha dad pa'am /
translated: thing,

original: bye brag gam /
analyzed: bye brag gam /
translated: no distinction,

original: khyad par du lta ba med de zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par du lta ba med de zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gsungs te /
translated: no difference whatsoever among any phenomena.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dngos po tha dad pa dag cig yod na ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dngos po tha dad pa dag cig yod na ni /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of generosity, and so on were separate things,

original: gcig sgrub pa'i phyir gcig la spyad ces byar rung na /
analyzed: gcig sgrub pa'i phyir gcig la spyad ces byar rung na /
translated: it would be appropriate to say, “Practice one for the sake of accomplishing one.”

original: chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir /
translated: However, the meaning is that because all those phenomena are ultimately inseparable in their nature,

original: gcig gi don du gcig la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de lha'i mig gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gcig gi don du gcig la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to // de lha'i mig gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: one should not practice one for the sake of the other.🔽He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the divine eye,

original: zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du /
translated: up to he does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: mngon par shes pa la brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of striving is taught through the elimination of the conceptualization of striving for the superknowledges.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: if one does not even see the perfection of wisdom itself, and so forth,

original: mngon par shes pa'i chos rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i chos rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: the reason is taught that the phenomena of the superknowledges and the perfection of wisdom itself are ultimately non-established.

original: tha dad du dbyer med pa ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tha dad du dbyer med pa ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The indivisibility is as explained above.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du bdag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la gnas te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du bdag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la gnas te /
translated: Moreover, Śāradvatīputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they think, Abiding in the bases of supernatural power,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In the world systems of the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad la rim gror bya'o //🔽bkur stir bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad la rim gror bya'o // bkur stir bya'o //
translated: I will serve all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones that are there.🔽I will honor them.

original: phu dud  du bya'o //
analyzed: phu dud  du bya'o //
translated: I will venerate them.

original: mchod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mchod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: I will make offerings to them.🔽I will not think like that, up to: I will not think, I will bring countless, immeasurable sentient beings to complete nirvana.

original: sems can grangs @63b med tshad med pa dag bdag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam du mi sems te zhes bya ba'i bar du mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la /
analyzed: sems can grangs @63b med tshad med pa dag bdag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam du mi sems te zhes bya ba'i bar du mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la /
translated: By the power of attaining the six superknowledges, in the ten directions,🔽the Buddhas are abandoned by the thought of making offerings and honors and by the thought of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: mchod cing bkur sti bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mchod cing bkur sti bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the nature of striving in terms of abandoning those thoughts.

original: gzhan ni rang log tu zad sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni rang log tu zad sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The other is the exhaustion of the self-reversal, the nirvana of all sentient beings, which is applied to the superknowledge of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: bdud glags tshol zhing nyams bskyod pa rnams kyis glags mi rnyed de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdud glags tshol zhing nyams bskyod pa rnams kyis glags mi rnyed de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The demons who seek an opportunity and disturb do not find an opportunity, and so on,🔽up to: they are never separated from the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du brtson pa'i mtshan nyid gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du brtson pa'i mtshan nyid gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the benefits of possessing the previously mentioned characteristics of effort.

original: phan yon de yang bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa'i phan yon dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don grub pa rnams lhun gyis grub pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad sel ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba las yongs su srung ba dang /
analyzed: phan yon de yang bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa'i phan yon dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don grub pa rnams lhun gyis grub pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad sel ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba las yongs su srung ba dang /
translated: And those benefits are the benefit of the demons not finding an opportunity, the spontaneous accomplishment of mundane and supramundane goals, the removal of all afflictions, the protection of the Blessed Buddhas of the ten directions from falling to the levels of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lha thams cad bar du gcod pa las yongs su srung pa dang / lus kyi skyon thams cad med par 'gyur ba dang ; gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i sgo mngon du 'gyur ba dang / skye ba thams cad du sangs rgyas mnyes par byed cing sangs rgyas dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang brgyad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lha thams cad bar du gcod pa las yongs su srung pa dang / lus kyi skyon thams cad med par 'gyur ba dang ; gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i sgo mngon du 'gyur ba dang / skye ba thams cad du sangs rgyas mnyes par byed cing sangs rgyas dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang brgyad de /
translated: The eight benefits are: all worldly gods completely protect one from obstacles; all physical faults are eliminated; the doors of dhāraṇī, samādhi, and so on become manifest; in all one’s lives one pleases the buddhas and never becomes separated from the buddhas.

original: de la bdud glags tshol zhing nyams bskyod pa rnams kyis glags mi rnyed de zhes bya bas ni bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: de la bdud glags tshol zhing nyams bskyod pa rnams kyis glags mi rnyed de zhes bya bas ni bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: “The māras who seek an opportunity and disturb one do not find an opportunity” teaches the benefit of māras not finding an opportunity.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lhun gyis grub pa dang / yongs su brtag pa med par mthun par 'grub bo zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lhun gyis grub pa dang / yongs su brtag pa med par mthun par 'grub bo zhes bya bas ni /
translated: “All mundane and supramundane activities are spontaneously accomplished and accomplished in accordance with one’s wishes without investigation” teaches the benefit of being able to accomplish all activities.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams lhun gyis grub pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams lhun gyis grub pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: The benefits of spontaneous accomplishment of mundane and supramundane aims are taught.

original: yongs su brtag pa med par zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'am the tshom med par 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa med par zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'am the tshom med par 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Without any investigation means without any doubt or hesitation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: And all the mundane afflictions that there are will be completely removed.

original: 'jig rten pa'i @64a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i @64a * //
translated: Mundane

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad sel ba'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad sel ba'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: afflictions are taught.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In the eastern direction, in as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: however many Bhagavat Buddhas there are, and so forth.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba las yongs su srung ba'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba las yongs su srung ba'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefits of the Buddhas of the ten directions protecting one from falling to the stages of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are taught.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The four great kings, the thirty-three gods, and so on,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams bar du gcod pa las srung ba'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams bar du gcod pa las srung ba'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: indicate the benefit of protection from obstacles by worldly gods.

original: de la lus kyi skyon du bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang tshe 'di nyid la thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de la lus kyi skyon du bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang tshe 'di nyid la thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Whatever physical faults there are, all of them will be completely eliminated in this very life.

original: lus la skyon med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: lus la skyon med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of a faultless body.🔽The doors of dhāraṇī, the doors of samādhi, eloquence, and the analytical knowledges will manifest without much difficulty.

original: gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i sgo dag kyang tshegs mi che bar mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i sgo 'grub pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i sgo dag kyang tshegs mi che bar mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i sgo 'grub pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of accomplishing dhāraṇī, samādhi, and so on.

original: tshegs mi che ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs shing 'bad mi dgos par 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshegs mi che ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs shing 'bad mi dgos par 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Without much difficulty means they are accomplished without affliction and exertion.

original: skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas mnyes par byed cing sangs rgyas dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //🔽sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni 'di snyam du chos gang la la zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos rnams 'du ba dang 'bral bar rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas mnyes par byed cing sangs rgyas dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o // sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni 'di snyam du chos gang la la zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos rnams 'du ba dang 'bral bar rnam par rtog pa
translated: The passage beginning in all the places of rebirth teaches the benefit of not being separated from the Buddhas and of pleasing the Buddhas.

original: spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning Moreover, Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom thinks like this: 'No dharma whatsoever ...' teaches the characteristic of striving by way of abandoning the discrimination of the meeting and separation of phenomena.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gang yang don dam par yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gang yang don dam par yod par ma grub pas /
translated: Since no phenomena of saṃsāra or nirvāṇa are ultimately established,

original: 'du ba dang 'bral ba la sogs pa yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'du ba dang 'bral ba la sogs pa yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: meeting and separation are also not established.

original: phrad pa'am mi phrad pa zhes bya ba yang 'du ba dang 'bral ba'i rnam grangs tsam du zad do //
analyzed: phrad pa'am mi phrad pa zhes bya ba yang 'du ba dang 'bral ba'i rnam grangs tsam du zad do //
translated: Meeting and not meeting are just synonyms for meeting and separation.

original: 'di snyam du bdag gi chos kyi dbyings mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gi chos kyi dbyings mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ram /
translated: He does not think, “Will I fully know the Reality limit?🔽Or will I not?”

original: 'on tam  mi 'gyur zhes bya bar mi sems te zhes bya bas ni mngon par 'tshang rgya bar rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'on tam  mi 'gyur zhes bya bar mi sems te zhes bya bas ni mngon par 'tshang rgya bar rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the characteristic of his effort to abandon the discrimination of full enlightenment.

original: @64b don dam par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @64b don dam par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, ultimately, the one who would fully awaken and the full awakening are not established.🔽He does not see any dharma as separate from the Reality limit.

original: chos gang yang chos kyi dbyings dang tha dad par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba yang don gong ma nyid gsal bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang yang chos kyi dbyings dang tha dad par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba yang don gong ma nyid gsal bar ston pa ste /
translated: This also clarifies the above meaning.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The so-called Reality limit is the nature of emptiness.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not separate from that is the nature of emptiness. This is the meaning.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang chos rnams su bye brag tu bya ba mi byed de zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos rnams thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pas mtshan nyid bye brag tu dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽chos kyi dbyings khong du chud par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang chos rnams su bye brag tu bya ba mi byed de zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos rnams thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pas mtshan nyid bye brag tu dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o // chos kyi dbyings khong du chud par 'gyur ram /
translated: The dharmadhatu and dharmas are not differentiated. This shows that ultimately all dharmas are of one taste in the dharmadhatu, so that their characteristics are not differentiated.

original: 'on tam khong du chud par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar mi sems te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dang bdag gnyis dbyer med pas khong du chud par byed pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on tam khong du chud par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar mi sems te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dang bdag gnyis dbyer med pas khong du chud par byed pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: One does not think, “Will I understand the dharmadhatu, or will I not understand it?” Because the dharmadhatu and the self are not differentiated, one does not apprehend anything to be understood or anyone to understand it.

original: de bas na de ni 'di ltar des chos gang gis chos gang khong du chud par bya ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de ni 'di ltar des chos gang gis chos gang khong du chud par bya ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In this way, one does not see any dharma at all by which one could understand any dharma.” This and the following passages explain the reason for this.

original: de yang 'di ltar de ni chos kyi dbyings stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor /🔽mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽don dam par chos kyi dbyings rtog par byar yang med pas stong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar de ni chos kyi dbyings stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor / mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni / don dam par chos kyi dbyings rtog par byar yang med pas stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Moreover, it is like this: that is not connected with the expression “the emptiness of the dharma-dhātu.”🔽It is not connected with the expression “the non-emptiness of the dharma-dhātu.”🔽The meaning of that is: since the dharma-dhātu is not even imagined ultimately, it is not imagined as “empty” or

original: mi stong zhes bya bar rtog par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzugs dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar rtog par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to // gzugs dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor /
translated: as “non-empty.”🔽Form is not connected with emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid dang gzugs su mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas /🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang gzugs su mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba nas / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor /
translated: Emptiness is not connected with form.🔽The element of mental consciousness is not connected with emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Emptiness is not connected with the element of mental consciousness.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi chos rnams stong pa nyid dang sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi chos rnams stong pa nyid dang sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i sgo nas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is: the characteristic of striving is taught by way of abandoning the conception that connects the phenomena of the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres with emptiness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: The nature of phenomena such as form is emptiness,

original: stong pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is like this:

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor 'di ni rnal 'byor dam pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor 'di ni rnal 'byor dam pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This yoga of emptiness is the highest yoga.

original: de'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /🔽chos rnams dngos po yod par lta zhing /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / chos rnams dngos po yod par lta zhing /
translated: This teaches the reason.🔽Those who view phenomena as existent things

original: @65a * // mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: @65a * // mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams ni /
translated: and grasp at signs

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid du sbyor ba srid kyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid du sbyor ba srid kyi /
translated: may combine form, etc., with emptiness,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnal 'byor 'di la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnal 'byor 'di la gnas pa ni /
translated: but those who abide in this yoga of practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnal 'byor dam pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnal 'byor dam pa ste /
translated: are the highest yoga because they are free from all signs.

original: de'i phyir de lta bur sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bur sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it means that they do not engage in such a combination.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, bodhisattva great beings who practice emptiness

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: The phrase “will not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level” and so forth teaches the benefits of possessing the characteristics of such effort.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar brtson pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phan yon nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar brtson pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phan yon nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang /
translated: They are: not falling to the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, purifying a buddha realm,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu myur du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba rnams bstan to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu myur du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba rnams bstan to //
translated: ripening sentient beings, and quickly attaining unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnal 'byor du bya ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnal 'byor du bya ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, whatever kinds of yoga there are,

original: de dag gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ni rab ces bya /
analyzed: de dag gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ni rab ces bya /
translated: among them the yoga of the perfection of wisdom is called the best,🔽called the supreme.

original: mchog ces bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar brtson pa'i phan yon gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mchog ces bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar brtson pa'i phan yon gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: And so forth. Because of possessing the benefits of such effort mentioned above,

original: nyan thos dang dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gang bas kyang lhag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhing rnal 'byor du byed pa 'di rab dang mchog la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gang bas kyang lhag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhing rnal 'byor du byed pa 'di rab dang mchog la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is superior to the yoga of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on, this striving in the perfection of wisdom and engaging in yoga is the best, the supreme, and so on.

original: rab ces bya ba dang mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bzang ba'i rnam grangs tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rab ces bya ba dang mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bzang ba'i rnam grangs tsam du zad do //
translated: The terms best and supreme are mere synonyms for good.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: It is because of this: This yoga of the perfection of wisdom... and so on.

original: rnal 'byor de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang ldan zhing /
translated: This yoga is endowed with the three doors of liberation

original: bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir rab dang mchog la sogs par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir rab dang mchog la sogs par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: and is unsurpassed, which is why it is the best, the supreme, and so on. This is the explanation of the reason.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who strives in this way is said to be one who has received a prophecy.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar brtson zhing rnal 'byor du byed pa ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar brtson zhing rnal 'byor du byed pa ni /
translated: “He is close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening” is the teaching of the benefits of one who is thus diligent and practices yoga in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa thob cing sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang / ring por mi thogs @65b par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa thob cing sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang / ring por mi thogs @65b par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the benefits of attaining the eighth bodhisattva stage, of being prophesied as a buddha, and of becoming a buddha in no long time is finished.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i don byed kyang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i don byed kyang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, the bodhisattva great beings who are thus diligent, though they benefit countless, immeasurable sentient beings,🔽up to ‘I will turn the wheel of the Dharma’ do not think like that.”

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba'i bar du de ltar brtson pa'i yon tan lung bstan pa la sogs pa dang ldan yang /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba'i bar du de ltar brtson pa'i yon tan lung bstan pa la sogs pa dang ldan yang /
translated: Though they have the qualities of being prophesied and so on,

original: bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no snyam mam /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no snyam mam /
translated: they do not think, “I am diligent in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: lung bstan pa la nye bar gyur pa yin no snyam mam /
analyzed: lung bstan pa la nye bar gyur pa yin no snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that they are close to a prophecy?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o snyam mam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that they are purifying a buddhafield?

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o snyam mam /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that they are bringing beings to maturity?

original: bdag sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o snyam du mtshan mar 'dzin cing rlom sems su 'gyur ba med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: bdag sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o snyam du mtshan mar 'dzin cing rlom sems su 'gyur ba med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: Do you think that they are turning the wheel of the Dharma after having attained awakening?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de chos kyi dbyings la bye brag tu 'byed pa med de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de chos kyi dbyings la bye brag tu 'byed pa med de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because they do not make distinctions in the dharma-constituent.🔽And why?

original: de lta bu'i chos gzhan gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos gzhan gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
translated: Because they do not see any other dharma at all.

original: de ltar rlom sems mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rlom sems mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that the reason that they do not give rise to conceit is that they do not see any other dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because bodhisattva great beings, when they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes mi skye'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes mi skye'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The idea of a sentient being does not arise, and so on, up to🔽the idea of one who sees does not arise.

original: mthong ba po'i 'du shes mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rlom sems mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: mthong ba po'i 'du shes mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rlom sems mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: This shows the reason why conceit does not occur.

original: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba rnam pa mang po ming gis smos pa rnams las 'ga' zhig gis 'du shes skye na ni /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba rnam pa mang po ming gis smos pa rnams las 'ga' zhig gis 'du shes skye na ni /
translated: If any of the many kinds of views of self imagined by the heterodox were to arise,

original: rlom sems kyang skye na bdag tu lta ba de rnams gang du yang 'du shes mi skye bas /
analyzed: rlom sems kyang skye na bdag tu lta ba de rnams gang du yang 'du shes mi skye bas /
translated: then conceit would also arise. But since those views of self do not arise in any way,

original: de lta bu'i rlom sems mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rlom sems mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: conceit does not occur. This is the meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?🔽This shows the reason why the idea of a self does not arise:

original: de ni 'di ltar sems can shin tu skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag tu 'du shes mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems can shin tu skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag tu 'du shes mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: because sentient beings are utterly unborn and unceasing.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, bodhisattva great beings who practice like this

original: sems can skye ba med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: sems can skye ba med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Since sentient beings are unborn, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar bdag tu lta ba'i 'du shes med pas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu lta ba'i 'du shes med pas /
translated: Thus, since they do not have the notion of a self-view,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu @66a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu @66a * //
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: phyin pa la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam grangs bstan to //
analyzed: phyin pa la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam grangs bstan to //
translated: has been taught to have the characteristics and categories of practice.🔽Śāradvatī­putra, this is the highest yoga of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnal 'byor dam pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnal 'byor dam pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Thus, the practice of the perfection of wisdom through the gateway of non-arising and non-ceasing, etc.,

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnal 'byor las 'phags pa'i phyir rnal 'byor dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnal 'byor las 'phags pa'i phyir rnal 'byor dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the highest yoga because it is superior to the yoga of all worldly beings, hearers, and solitary realizers.

original: de bas na des de ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor rnams zil gyis mnan te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na des de ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor rnams zil gyis mnan te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it outshines all other yogas.

original: de ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor te /
translated: The so-called “yoga other than that” is the yoga of the world, of the śrāvakas, and of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag las 'phags pa'i phyir zil gyis mnan te gnas so zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las 'phags pa'i phyir zil gyis mnan te gnas so zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Because they are superior to those, they are explained as “abiding in the state of having overcome them.”🔽Śāradvatī­putra, bodhisattva great beings who practice this yoga accomplish the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnal 'byor 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu mngon par sgrub po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor dam pa de la spyod pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnal 'byor 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu mngon par sgrub po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor dam pa de la spyod pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: This and the rest of the passage teaches the qualities of practicing that excellent yoga.

original: yon tan de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams sgrub nus pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams sgrub nus pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa med pa bstan to //
translated: Those qualities are the ability to accomplish the qualities of the buddhas, such as the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and the absence of the opposing factors of the six perfections, such as stinginess.

original: 'di yan chad du brtson pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad du brtson pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
translated: Up to this point, the characteristics of the diligent ones have been explained.

original: da ni brtson pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brtson pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the classification of the diligent ones,

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'dis spyod pa de /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'dis spyod pa de /
translated: the elder Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices with this yoga of the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa lags /
analyzed: gang nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa lags /
translated: from what state of existence has he transmigrated and been born here?🔽And after transmigrating from here, where will he be born?” He asked about the state of existence from which he came and the state of existence where he will be born.

original: 'di nas tshe 'phos nas gang du skye bar 'gyur zhes gnas gang nas lhags pa dang / gnas gar skye ba'i sa phyogs zhus pa dang / de'i lan du gnas gang nas lhags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nas tshe 'phos nas gang du skye bar 'gyur zhes gnas gang nas lhags pa dang / gnas gar skye ba'i sa phyogs zhus pa dang / de'i lan du gnas gang nas lhags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In reply to that, in order to show the state of existence from which he came,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'dis rnam par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'dis rnam par spyod pa ni /
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices with this yoga of the perfection of wisdom,🔽has transmigrated from another buddha field and been born here,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa'am /
translated: or who have been reborn here after having died in another buddhafield,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris dang / mi'i nang nas tshe @66b 'phos te 'dir skyes par shes par bya'o zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris dang / mi'i nang nas tshe @66b 'phos te 'dir skyes par shes par bya'o zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: One should know that he has passed away from the god realm of Tushita or from the human realm and has been reborn here.

original: de ltar gnas gang nas lhags pa'i sa phyogs spyir bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas gang nas lhags pa'i sa phyogs spyir bstan nas /
translated: Having thus generally indicated the place from which he has come,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ;
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ;
translated: the Lord said, Sharadviati, a bodhisattva-mahasattva who has passed away from another buddha-field and been reborn here...

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba mdor bsdus nas rab 'bring rnam pa gsum du phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba mdor bsdus nas rab 'bring rnam pa gsum du phye ste bstan to //
translated: Thus, having briefly distinguished the bodhisattva-mahasattvas who strive in the perfection of wisdom into three categories of highest, middling, and lowest, he taught.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa de ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa de ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Among them, a bodhisattva-mahasattva who has passed away from another buddha-field and been reborn here...

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la yang bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la yang bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: They will also serve and attend upon those tathāgatas, those arhats, those perfectly awakened ones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab rnon po mchog rnams bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab rnon po mchog rnams bstan te /
translated: Up to here, it shows the bodhisattvas of sharp faculties, the supreme ones.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa'i shugs kyis 'dir skyes na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'di myur du 'grub pa dang / 'di nas tshe 'phos na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos zab mo 'di mngon sum du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa'i shugs kyis 'dir skyes na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'di myur du 'grub pa dang / 'di nas tshe 'phos na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos zab mo 'di mngon sum du 'gyur zhing /
translated: In a pure buddhafield, having practiced the perfection of wisdom again and again, even if born here, this yoga of the perfection of wisdom is quickly accomplished, and even after transmigrating from here, this profound Dharma of the perfection of wisdom will be directly perceived.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye ba dang / sangs rgyas de rnams la bsnyen bkur byed nus par 'gyur ba de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye ba dang / sangs rgyas de rnams la bsnyen bkur byed nus par 'gyur ba de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: There are also those who, through the power of the perfection of wisdom, are able to enter into the yoga of meditative equipoise on the perfection of wisdom, to be born in a pure buddhafield, and to be able to serve those buddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la /
translated: In the yoga of the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnal 'byor myur du 'grub ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgom pa la brtson par byed pa na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor myur du 'grub ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgom pa la brtson par byed pa na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la /
translated: the yoga is quickly accomplished means that when one strives to cultivate the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, one cultivates nonconceptual samādhi.

original: sems rtse gcig tu gnas shing bsam gtan las su rung ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gnas shing bsam gtan las su rung ste /
translated: The mind abides one-pointedly and becomes serviceable in meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi nyams myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi nyams myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one quickly attains the experience of meditative concentration.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas tshe 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa de ni tshe gcig gis thogs pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas tshe 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa de ni tshe gcig gis thogs pa ste /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, those bodhisattva great beings who are reborn here after passing away from the Tuṣita gods are those who are impeded by only one birth.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug las nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug las nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: They do not regress from the six perfections.

original: gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad kyang @67a * //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad kyang @67a * //
translated: All the dhāraṇī gateways and all the samādhi gateways

original: der ma 'dus pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der ma 'dus pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: are included in that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi nang nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi nang nas /
translated: Among the bodhisattva great beings,

original: shes rab 'bring dang ldan pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: shes rab 'bring dang ldan pa rnams bstan te /
translated: those who possess middling wisdom are taught.

original: de dag ni dga' ldan lha'i ris nas tshe 'phos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir skyes te pha rol tu phyin pa drug mi nyams pa dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang ldan pa de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni dga' ldan lha'i ris nas tshe 'phos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir skyes te pha rol tu phyin pa drug mi nyams pa dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang ldan pa de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those who are reborn in this buddha field after passing away from the Tuṣita gods are those who do not regress from the six perfections and who possess all the dhāraṇī gateways and samādhi gateways.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi'i nang nas tshe 'phos nas mi dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du skyes pa de ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi'i nang nas tshe 'phos nas mi dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du skyes pa de ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to,

original: de la gzungs kyi sgo dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang myur du mngon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nang nas /
analyzed: de la gzungs kyi sgo dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang myur du mngon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nang nas /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways and the meditative absorption gateways will not quickly manifest for them.”

original: shes rab rtul po tha ma rnams bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab rtul po tha ma rnams bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches about the bodhisattva great beings of dull faculties, the lowest.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Except for the irreversible bodhisattva great beings” means

original: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa kha cig sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis mi'i nang du skye zhing tshe 'phos pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa kha cig sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis mi'i nang du skye zhing tshe 'phos pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: that some irreversible bodhisattvas on the eighth ground are reborn among humans due to the power of benefiting sentient beings and pass away from there.

original: de dag ni dbang po rtul po ma yin la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la yang mnyam par 'jog nus shing /
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po rtul po ma yin la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la yang mnyam par 'jog nus shing /
translated: They are not of dull faculties and are able to rest in equipoise in the yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang thob par nus kyi /
analyzed: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang thob par nus kyi /
translated: They are able to attain the dhāraṇī and the doors of samādhi.

original: de la ma gtogs pa dge ba'i las dang bsod nams kyi dbang gis mi'i nang nas tshe 'phos te /
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa dge ba'i las dang bsod nams kyi dbang gis mi'i nang nas tshe 'phos te /
translated: But some who, due to the power of virtuous karma and merit, have passed away from the human realm

original: mi'i nang du skyes pa kha cig ni de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson yang sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par ma byas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul bas /
analyzed: mi'i nang du skyes pa kha cig ni de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson yang sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par ma byas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul bas /
translated: and are reborn among humans, even though they strive in the perfection of wisdom at that time, due to not having previously familiarized themselves with the perfection of wisdom and due to their dull faculties by nature,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la myur du mnyam par 'jog mi nus la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la myur du mnyam par 'jog mi nus la /
translated: are unable to quickly rest in equipoise in the yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang myur du mngon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang myur du mngon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The dhāraṇī and the doors of samādhi do not quickly manifest for them.

original: myur du mngon du mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar na /
analyzed: myur du mngon du mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar na /
translated: If this is applied to the statement “they will not quickly manifest,”

original: tshe 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pa la sogs kyis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pa la sogs kyis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means that they will be attained by those who have cultivated the perfection of wisdom in this life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Such bodhisattvas do exist.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gang khyod kyis de skad du zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gang khyod kyis de skad du zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, you have asked thus:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang @67b 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang @67b 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to “they will not be separated from the blessed buddhas.”

original: gong du zhus pa'i lan rab 'bring gsum du rnam par phye ste bstan nas /
analyzed: gong du zhus pa'i lan rab 'bring gsum du rnam par phye ste bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the reply to the above question in terms of the best, middling, and least,

original: de nas mdor bsdus te lan btab pa de yin no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mdor bsdus te lan btab pa de yin no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: the Blessed One said, “This is the brief reply.”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni brtson pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni brtson pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyas par bstan pa ste /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, unskilled bodhisattva great beings, and so on, extensively teaches the divisions of those who strive.

original: de dag kyang thabs la mkhas mi mkhas dang / dbang po rno rtul dang / spyod pa'i khyad par las rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa lnga yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang thabs la mkhas mi mkhas dang / dbang po rno rtul dang / spyod pa'i khyad par las rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa lnga yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood as having forty five types due to the differences of skill in means, sharp and dull faculties and conduct.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

analyzed: der skyes pa'i rgyus sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byed na yang dbang po rtul por 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste de ni dang po ste rnam pa gcig go //

translated: Śāradvatīputra, there are also those bodhisattva great beings who, from the very first arousal of the mind of awakening, and so on up to🔽who go to the buddha realms in order to purify the buddha realms.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: Once they have attained the first ground, they should complete the yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor mang po dang bcas par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong ba dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor mang po dang bcas par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong ba dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: There are also those who, together with a great retinue of bodhisattvas, go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to see the blessed buddhas, to bring beings to maturity, and to purify a buddhafield.

original: de ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifteenth.

original: shar dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shar dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Easterners, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom, from the Sūtra on the Perfection of Wisdom in One Letter.

original: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag yang dang yang du rnam par mnan cing snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /

translated: Those who are skilled in means repeatedly enter and emerge from these meditative concentrations, immeasurables, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la dbang du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la dbang du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate mastery of meditative concentration and meditative stabilization,

original: thabs mkhas pas thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: it is taught that there are also those who enter meditative absorption by skipping over stages.

original: de ni bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcu drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixteenth.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi thob pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi thob pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, it is like this: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who has attained the four establishments of mindfulness...

original: de dag ni phyir mi ldog par shes par bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de dag ni phyir mi ldog par shes par bya ba'i bar du ni /

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ldan zhing yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa yongs su shes par byas kyang de dag mngon sum du mi byed par sems can gzhan rnams lam gyi 'bras bu de dag la so sor 'god
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ldan zhing yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa yongs su shes par byas kyang de dag mngon sum du mi byed par sems can gzhan rnams lam gyi 'bras bu de dag la so sor 'god
translated: It is the knowledge of the bodhisattvas that is endowed with and familiar with the factors of awakening and the qualities of the buddhas.

original: pa dag kyang yod @70a * //
analyzed: pa dag kyang yod @70a * //
translated: Even though they have fully understood the fruits of stream enterer and so on, they do not actualize them, but instead establish other sentient beings in those fruits of the path.

original: do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: do zhes bstan pa ste /

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The wisdom that is the attainment of the fruits of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is the acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa'i ye shes de byang chub sems dpas thob kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa'i ye shes de byang chub sems dpas thob kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas /
translated: The wisdom that is the attainment of the fruits of stream enterer and so on by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is attained by the bodhisattvas. However, because they have attained the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la mi gnas bar de dag shes par bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la mi gnas bar de dag shes par bya ste /
translated: They do not remain in the results of stream-enterer and so on, like the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed nus pa nyid la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed nus pa nyid la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called “forbearance” because they are able to bring beings to full maturity and to purify the buddhafields.

original: de ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventeenth.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, there are also bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections,

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod de ;
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod de ;
translated: purify the abode of the Heaven of Joy.

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni bskal pa bzang po par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, those bodhisattva great beings should be known as the good eons.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas /
translated: Abiding in the six perfections of nonconceptuality,

original: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la mngon par sangs rgyas par byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la mngon par sangs rgyas par byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste ;
translated: There are also those who will fully awaken to buddhahood in this very Fortunate Eon.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la dga' ldan gyi lha'i pho brang du mngon par sangs rgyas nas /

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris kyi sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su dag par mdzad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris kyi sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su dag par mdzad pa la bya ste /
translated: he will purify the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment of the Joyous Heaven.

original: de ni bco brgyad pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni bco brgyad pa'o ;
translated: This is the eighteenth.

analyzed: / sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is in this way that great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, from the first level up to the tenth level,

analyzed: de dag ni tshe gcig gis thogs par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dag / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: There are bodhisattvas who are impeded by one birth, who are endowed with the qualities of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas, and who,

analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas khong du chud par byed kyi /

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ltar mngon sum du mi byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa @70b ste ;

translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is in this way that great bodhisattva beings who practice the six transcendent perfections, and who are skilled in means,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la la myur du mngon par 'tshang mi rgya bar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang /

analyzed: sems can rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'dod pa las dben pa la 'god pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /

original: de ni nyi shu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nyi shu bdun pa'o //

analyzed: de ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //

original: de ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //

analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'gres ni sum cu gcig pa'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod @72a * //
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is also the case that when great bodhisattva beings practice the six perfections,

analyzed: ba'i tshe zhes bya ba nas /
translated: from here up to

analyzed: spyod lam mdzes pas skye bo thams cad kyi yid du 'ong bar byas te /

original: de ni sum cu dgu pa'o//
analyzed: de ni sum cu dgu pa'o//

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Sharadviila's son, it is like this: There are bodhisattva-mahasattvas who, from the time when they first began their practice of mind, up to sitting on the seat of awakening, do not have any break in their recollection and do not have any distraction of mind.

original: gzhan mi smod pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: gzhan mi smod pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: There are those who, without criticizing others, do not have any break in their recollection and do not have any distraction of mind.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /

analyzed: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod pa'i sgo nas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: There are those who bring sentient beings to full maturity by not praising themselves and not disparaging others.

original: de ni bzhi bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bzhi bcu pa'o //

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad ces bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is also the case that, from the time of their initial arousal of the mind of awakening, certain bodhisattva great beings

analyzed: log par 'gro ba dang ngan song du mi ltung ba dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni / sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
