analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis kyi 'bras bus dbul ba'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal mi myong bar sems can gyi don la brtson pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught in the passage that begins with “Śāradvatī­putra, it is also the case that, from the time of their initial arousal of the mind of awakening, certain bodhisattva great beings” and ends with “There are those who do not experience the suffering of poverty and the suffering of the lower realms due to the results of those two perfections and who are dedicated to the welfare of sentient beings.”

original: de ni bzhi bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bzhi bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the forty-first.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, there are also some bodhisattva great beings who, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening until they attain the irreversible level, never abandon the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' kha cig dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam lhur blangs nas sa dang po @72b thob par byas te /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' kha cig dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam lhur blangs nas sa dang po @72b thob par byas te /

analyzed: sems can rnams kyang dge ba bcu la 'god pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: They then establish sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions.

original: de ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the forty-second.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, there are also some bodhisattva great beings who, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening until they attain the irreversible level, never abandon the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: sbyin pa dang ngag snyan pas sems can yongs su sdud pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ngag snyan pas sems can yongs su sdud pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /

original: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur blangs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur blangs te /

analyzed: bsdu ba rnam pa gnyis kyis sdud pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /

analyzed: de ni bzhi bcu gsum pa'o //

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa sna tshogs kyis rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / phu dud dang / mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, it is like this:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur len cing /

analyzed: tshe rabs du mar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la gnas te /

analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas mang po mnyes par byed cing /

analyzed: mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /

original: de ni bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is like this: There are some great bodhisattva beings who, abiding in the six transcendent perfections,🔽never part from that illumination of the sacred doctrine.

analyzed: chos snang ba de dang nam yang bral bar mi byed pa dag kyang yod de zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /

translated: Some bodhisattvas, abiding in the six transcendent perfections, teach the sacred doctrine and dispel the darkness of ignorance of sentient beings.🔽Having brought them to full maturity, they attain manifest perfect buddhahood.

analyzed: yongs su smin par byas nas mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This is what is taught.

analyzed: de ni bzhi bcu lnga pa'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag nyid las gleng bslangs nas /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, therefore, bodhisattva-mahāsattva, and so on, having raised the discussion from just those bodhisattvas,

analyzed: chos rgya cher bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir gsungs te /
translated: in order to open the section on extensively explaining the Dharma, it is said.

analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir sdig pa mi dge ba'i las la mi bya'i /
translated: Here, in this context, the phrase blameworthy actions of body, speech, and mind should not be taken to mean sinful, non-virtuous actions.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi las kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi las kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The actions of body, speech, and mind that are accompanied by reference are called reprehensible.🔽Because they are accompanied by reference, they are a fault for a bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir de lta bu'i go skabs mi dbye'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir de lta bu'i go skabs mi dbye'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should not open the door to such [faults].🔽Thus have I heard, etc.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The venerable Śāradvatīputra, having thus been addressed, said to the Lord, etc.

original: don dang tshig de nyid las glengs te /
analyzed: don dang tshig de nyid las glengs te /
translated: [The text] continues from just that meaning and those words.

original: chos rgya cher bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: chos rgya cher bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: In order to open the section on explaining the Dharma extensively, [he] asked, What are the reprehensible actions of body, speech, and mind?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The Blessed One said, etc.

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi las kha na ma tho ba gang yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi las kha na ma tho ba gang yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: [The text] teaches what the reprehensible actions of body, speech, and mind are.

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum dngos po yod par dmigs pa dang / de dag gis bya zhing brtsams pa'i las dngos po yod par lta ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum dngos po yod par dmigs pa dang / de dag gis bya zhing brtsams pa'i las dngos po yod par lta ba ni /
translated: The view that the three, body, speech, and mind, are real entities, and the view that the actions performed by them are real entities,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon yin pas kha na ma tho ba dang 'dra bar spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon yin pas kha na ma tho ba dang 'dra bar spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: are called “faults” because they are to be abandoned like faults.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: lus gang dang / ngag gang dang / yid gang gis 'jungs pa'i sems bskyed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jungs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i lus dang ngag yid gsum mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: lus gang dang / ngag gang dang / yid gang gis 'jungs pa'i sems bskyed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jungs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i lus dang ngag yid gsum mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: do not apprehend the body, speech, or mind by which they would give rise to a miserly thought, and so on. This teaches the non-apprehension of the three, body, speech, and mind, by which the six perfections’ counteragents, miserliness and so on, arise.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase “arising of the body’s negative condition” continues up to the phrase “the mind’s negative condition.”

original: yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: The phrase “the mind’s negative condition” continues up to the phrase “the mind’s morally blameless action.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' la @73b lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung ba dang / ci'i phyir kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la @73b lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung ba dang / ci'i phyir kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches that a bodhisattva does not commit any morally reprehensible actions through body, speech, or mind and it provides the reasons why he or she does not commit such actions.

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa tsam du ni shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa tsam du ni shes par mi bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the bodhisattva does not commit any morally reprehensible actions through body, speech, or mind.

original: de ni gnas med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni gnas med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “this is impossible” means

original: byang chub sems dpa' la lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i skyon de lta bu 'byung mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽gnas ngan len zhes bya ba dang / kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni 'phyas su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i skyon de lta bu 'byung mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don te / gnas ngan len zhes bya ba dang / kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni 'phyas su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: that it is impossible for a bodhisattva to commit any of the errors that are associated with the mental afflictions through body, speech, or mind.

original: skyon du 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The terms “negative condition” and “morally blameworthy” are synonyms for “fault” and “defect.”

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ngo zhes bya ba ;
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ngo zhes bya ba ;
translated: He purifies the body’s negative tendencies.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni lus kyi skyon dag par byed cing med par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni lus kyi skyon dag par byed cing med par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva purifies the body’s faults and makes them non-existent.

original: skyon de lta bu skyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyon de lta bu skyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not produce such faults.

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: He asks, “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas purify the body’s negative tendencies?” and so on.

original: chos nyan pa'i 'khor rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i 'khor rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubts of the assembly listening to the Dharma,

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi gnas ngan len ji ltar sbyong zhes zhus pa dang / lus dang ngag yid gsum don dam par mi dmigs pa nyid gnas ngan len sbyong ba yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi gnas ngan len ji ltar sbyong zhes zhus pa dang / lus dang ngag yid gsum don dam par mi dmigs pa nyid gnas ngan len sbyong ba yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: he asks how the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind are purified, and it is explained that the ultimate non-apprehension of body, speech, and mind itself is the purification of negative tendencies.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, from the time of first generating the mind of enlightenment,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Having taken up the path of the ten virtues and abiding in them, and so on,🔽is taught in another way, in terms of the conventional, as the faultlessness of body, speech, and mind.

original: kun rdzob tu lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi skyon med pa rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob nas dge ba bcu la gnas te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi skyon med pa rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob nas dge ba bcu la gnas te /
translated: Having attained the first bodhisattva level, abiding in the ten virtues,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems mi skye bar sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed pa yang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems mi skye bar sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed pa yang /
translated: and not giving rise to the attitude of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, but giving rise to great compassion for all sentient beings,

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi skyon sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi skyon sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is taught as the purification of the faults of body, speech, and mind.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: purifying the path to enlightenment, and so on,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de lta bu dag kyang yod do @74a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de lta bu dag kyang yod do @74a * //
translated: There are those who purify the path to enlightenment and complete the six perfections such as generosity.

original: zhes brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Thus it shows the divisions of striving.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s path to enlightenment?”

original: gang byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa dag kyang yod do zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa dag kyang yod do zhes bshad pa la /
translated: This is because it was explained, “There are those who purify the path to enlightenment and practice the six perfections.”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ma gtogs par byang chub kyi lam gzhan gang zhig yod snyam nas zhus pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ma gtogs par byang chub kyi lam gzhan gang zhig yod snyam nas zhus pa'o //
translated: Thinking, “Apart from the six perfections, what other path to enlightenment is there?” he asked.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s path to enlightenment is as follows:

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad la dmigs pa med cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad la dmigs pa med cing /
translated: It is like this: all phenomena are without reference point,

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: without acceptance and without rejection.”

original: byang chub kyi lam gang yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gang yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on the path to enlightenment.

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams dngos po yod par mi blta ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams dngos po yod par mi blta ste /
translated: One should not view the phenomena mentioned by name, such as body, speech, mind, and so on, as existent things.

original: de dag la mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of being the cause for attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, which is the very non-apprehension of those, it is called the path to enlightenment.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing nan tan du byed pa de dag ni sus kyang thub pa med do zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing nan tan du byed pa de dag ni sus kyang thub pa med do zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice and exert themselves in the six perfections through such a path cannot be overcome by anyone.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la bdud dang bar du gcod pa sus kyang mi tshugs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la bdud dang bar du gcod pa sus kyang mi tshugs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that Māra and obstacles cannot harm that bodhisattva who abides in the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams thub pa ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams thub pa ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, Blessed One, in what way do the bodhisattva great beings practice so that they are invincible?

original: gong du cis kyang mi tshugs pa'i yon tan mdor bshad pa de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gong du cis kyang mi tshugs pa'i yon tan mdor bshad pa de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question to open the section on the detailed explanation of just those qualities that cannot be harmed by anything mentioned above.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽When the bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they are without conceit about form, and so on up to they are without conceit about nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rlom sems med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rlom sems med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: At that time,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel ba yin te sus kyang thub pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel ba yin te sus kyang thub pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings increase through the six perfections and no one can overcome them.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos gang la yang dngos po yod par mi @74b sems par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos gang la yang dngos po yod par mi @74b sems par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one does not think that any conditioned or unconditioned phenomenon has a real substance,

original: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pa sus kyang mi tshugs shing bar chad byed mi nus so zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pa sus kyang mi tshugs shing bar chad byed mi nus so zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: at that time, no demon, opponent, etc. can harm one, and no one can create an obstacle.

original: rlom sems zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod par sems shing de dag la brten pa'am bsnyems pa'o //
analyzed: rlom sems zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod par sems shing de dag la brten pa'am bsnyems pa'o //
translated: What is called conceit is thinking that something has a real substance and relying on it or being arrogant about it.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, it is like this: Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas, abiding in the six perfections,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: perfect the wisdom of omniscience, and so on,

original: de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: up to there are those who do not take up such a body.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthu rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir gnas brtan sha ra dva ti'i bu the tshom 'drir gzhug pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthu rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir gnas brtan sha ra dva ti'i bu the tshom 'drir gzhug pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the power of the wisdom of omniscience, the elder Shariputra is made to ask a question in order to open up the discussion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ngan song rnams su mi skye zhing mi dbul po dang dman pa'i lus su mi skye ba dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ngan song rnams su mi skye zhing mi dbul po dang dman pa'i lus su mi skye ba dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: There are some bodhisattvas who, while perfecting the wisdom of omniscience, are not reborn in the lower realms and do not take up poor human bodies.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Shariputra said to the Lord...🔽...what is that wisdom of omniscience by which one does not take up such a body?

original: de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de gang lags zhes bya ba'i bar du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mnga'i /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de gang lags zhes bya ba'i bar du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mnga'i /
translated: Since the wisdom of omniscience belongs to the Tathagata

original: byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' ba'i rigs na /
translated: and does not belong to the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la mnga' ba'i ye shes de gang lags zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la mnga' ba'i ye shes de gang lags zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: What is the wisdom possessed by the bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: he also sees the distinctions of the qualities of the buddha-field.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba dang / de dag las chos nyan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang 'grogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa mthong bar nus pa'i ye shes yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba dang / de dag las chos nyan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang 'grogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa mthong bar nus pa'i ye shes yod de /
translated: From the eighth bodhisattva stage onward, the bodhisattva is able to see many tathagatas in the ten directions, to listen to the Dharma from them, to associate with the bodhisattva sangha, and to see the completely pure buddha-fields.

original: ye shes de lta bu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu'i gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes de lta bu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu'i gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan no zhes bshad do //

analyzed: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @75a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses such wisdom,

original: chen po ni /
analyzed: chen po ni /
translated: The great

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: means that one does not generate the idea of a Buddha, and so forth, up to

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /

original: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan na kun rdzob tu chos thams cad la spyod cing bsgom yang don dam par chos de gang la yang dngos po'i 'du shes mi skye ba dang / dngos por mi dmigs pa dang / dngos po yod par mi lta ba'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan na kun rdzob tu chos thams cad la spyod cing bsgom yang don dam par chos de gang la yang dngos po'i 'du shes mi skye ba dang / dngos por mi dmigs pa dang / dngos po yod par mi lta ba'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The qualities of having such wisdom are that one practices and meditates on all phenomena conventionally, but ultimately one does not generate the idea of any phenomenon as a thing, one does not observe anything as a thing, and one does not view anything as existent.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

original: mig lnga rab tu thob pa dang / yongs su sbyong ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: mig lnga rab tu thob pa dang / yongs su sbyong ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la la spyan lnga dang ldan pa yang yod do zhes brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa ste /

original: sngar spyan lnga bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: sngar spyan lnga bstan pa ni ;
translated: The teaching of the five eyes above

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga'i skabs su bstan pa 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyan lngar bshad pa'i skabs su bstan pas lan gnyis su zlos pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga'i skabs su bstan pa 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyan lngar bshad pa'i skabs su bstan pas lan gnyis su zlos pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: was in the context of the five eyes of the Tathagata. Here, the teaching of the five eyes is in the context of the bodhisattva's five eyes, so there is no fault of repetition.

original: de la sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba nas /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mthon dman dang / yon tan che chung gi rim pa las ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mthon dman dang / yon tan che chung gi rim pa las ;
translated: It is in accordance with the high and low stages of the bodhisattva and the sequence of greater and lesser qualities.

analyzed: la la'i sha'i mig gis ni dpag tshad brgya tshun chad mthong / la las ni dpag tshad stong mthong /

analyzed: la las ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun mthong ba yang yod de /
translated: Some see the entire trichiliocosm.

original: mdor na dngos po gzugs can du gtogs pa thams cad la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig ces bya'o //

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pas ni /

analyzed: shes rab kyis thogs pa med par 'jug cing mkhyen pa la /

translated: That concentration is called “immediately preceding concentration” because the result of stream enterer is obtained immediately after that concentration without anything else intervening.

analyzed: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /

translated: When the result of stream enterer is obtained,🔽the knowledge through seeing of liberation is obtained and seen that was not obtained and not seen before.

analyzed: thob cing mthong bar gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes kyang bya ste /

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de la sgrib pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs te /

analyzed: de dag las grol ba'i ye shes thob pa la /

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas /
translated: Through the vision of the wisdom of liberation,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i kun du sbyor ba gsum rab tu spong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /

original: de ltar rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa na /
translated: Thus, when one attains the fruit of stream-entry,

original: kun du sbyor ba'i chos gsum spong ste /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i chos gsum spong ste /

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called view of the transitory collection is

translated: to view the five aggregates, which are by nature subject to destruction, as a single self that is permanent.

original: the tshom ni 'phags pa'i bden pa la yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni 'phags pa'i bden pa la yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: Doubt is to be uncertain about the noble truths.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa ni /
translated: Holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount is

translated: They hold that nirvana is attained merely by observing moral discipline and by undergoing the hardships of ascetic practices.

analyzed: @76b chos de gsum gyis grol zhing thar par ma 'gyur gyi 'khor bar kun du sbyor zhing skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: These three dharmas do not lead to liberation and freedom, but rather to bondage and rebirth in cyclic existence.

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gang zag 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This person is called a stream-enterer.

original: de ltar yon tan gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan pa de lta bu'i gang zag 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no zhes shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan pa de lta bu'i gang zag 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no zhes shes pa ste /
translated: A person who possesses the above-mentioned qualities is called a stream-enterer.

original: de lta bu'i shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi spyan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi spyan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This kind of knowledge is called the bodhisattva’s Dharma eye.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam rab tu thob nas /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam rab tu thob nas /
translated: Having attained the path of cultivation in this way,
