analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / ngan sems rab tu srab par byed de /
translated: he weakens desire for the sense objects of the desire realm and weakens malice.

original: gang zag 'di ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This person is called a once-returner.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: He has attained the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa yan chad la bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ste /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos ji ltar mthong ba de nyid gsal bar bya zhing /🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa yan chad la bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ste / zag pa med pa'i chos ji ltar mthong ba de nyid gsal bar bya zhing / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'i phyir /
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation of the truths that have been seen, beginning with the path of insight.

original: yang dang yang du goms par byed pa la bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya'o //🔽'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni /
analyzed: yang dang yang du goms par byed pa la bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya'o // 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni /
translated: It is called the path of cultivation because one cultivates again and again in order to make manifest the uncontaminated dharmas that have been seen and in order to abandon the counteragents.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags kyi yul rnams la zhen pa la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags kyi yul rnams la zhen pa la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
translated: Desire for sense-pleasures is the desire for the objects of desire of the realm of desire.

original: ngan sems zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis sems can gzhan la gnod par sems pa'o //🔽de ltar bsgom pa'i lam la gnas shing /
analyzed: ngan sems zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis sems can gzhan la gnod par sems pa'o // de ltar bsgom pa'i lam la gnas shing /
translated: Evil thoughts are thoughts of harming other sentient beings through hatred.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis spong bar sbyor ba'i gang zag de mi dang lha rnams kyi nang du lan cig skyes te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis spong bar sbyor ba'i gang zag de mi dang lha rnams kyi nang du lan cig skyes te /
translated: The person who, abiding in the path of cultivation, is engaged in abandoning desire and hatred, is reborn once among humans or gods.

original: de phan chad mi dang lha'i nang du mi skye ba la lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phan chad mi dang lha'i nang du mi skye ba la lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: From then on, he is not reborn among humans or gods, and is called a “once-returner.”

original: de lam de nyid de bas kyang shin tu bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de lam de nyid de bas kyang shin tu bsgoms nas /
translated: Having cultivated that path even more,

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems rab tu spong ba thob par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems rab tu spong ba thob par byed de /
translated: he attains the abandonment of desire and malice.

original: gang zag 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This person is called a “non-returner.”

original: bsgom pa'i lam de nyid la gnas te lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de nyid la gnas te lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i tshe /
translated: Abiding in that path of cultivation,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang srab mor byas pa de dag ma lus par spong ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang srab mor byas pa de dag ma lus par spong ba ni /
translated: he completely abandons desire and malice, which have become weak,

original: slar lha dang mi'i nang du mi skye bas na phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slar lha dang mi'i nang du mi skye bas na phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and is not reborn again among gods or humans. Therefore, he is called a “non-returner.”

original: de lam de nyid de bas kyang shin tu bsgoms pas /🔽gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /🔽gang zag dgra bcom pa'i rgyus bstan te /
analyzed: de lam de nyid de bas kyang shin tu bsgoms pas / gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas / gang zag dgra bcom pa'i rgyus bstan te /
translated: Having cultivated that path even more,

original: gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / @77a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / @77a * //
translated: he abandons desire for the form realm and the formless realm,🔽and pride, etc.🔽This person is called an “arhat.”

original: ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang rgol ba spangs pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang rgol ba spangs pas /
translated: By abandoning ignorance, pride, and resistance,

original: dgra bcom pa thob par bstan pa ste /🔽gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa thob par bstan pa ste / gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags ni /
translated: he has attained the state of an arhat.🔽The attachment to the form and formless realms

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa'o //
translated: is the attachment to the taste of the meditative concentration of the four meditative concentrations of the form realm and the four meditative absorptions of the formless realm.

original: ma rig pa ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la mi shes pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la mi shes pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the obscuration of not knowing the meditative concentrations and meditative absorptions.

original: nga rgyal ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin de dag nyid bsnyems pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin de dag nyid bsnyems pa'o //
translated: Pride is the haughtiness of those meditative concentrations and meditative absorptions.

original: rgod pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rgod pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is equipoised in the meditative concentration and meditative absorption of excitation,

original: zhi gnas kyi shas chung zhing lhag mthong gi shas che bas sems g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi shas chung zhing lhag mthong gi shas che bas sems g-yeng ba ste /
translated: because the portion of śamatha is small and the portion of vipaśyanā is great, the mind is distracted.

original: skyon de rnams spangs pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la /
analyzed: skyon de rnams spangs pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la /
translated: By abandoning those faults, one is free from the afflictions of the three realms.

original: gang zag dgra bcom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag dgra bcom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That person is called an arhat.

original: gang zag gi rim pa de lta bu dag shes pa ni /
analyzed: gang zag gi rim pa de lta bu dag shes pa ni /
translated: Knowing such states of persons

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi spyan zhes bya'o //🔽gang zag 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi spyan zhes bya'o // gang zag 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: is called the bodhisattvas’ eye of Dharma.

original: gang zag 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “This person is established in the signless” up to “This person is an arhat.”

original: khyad par du rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te bsgom pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te bsgom pa tsam du zad do //
translated: In particular, he is established in the signless meditative stabilization, the door of liberation, and merely cultivates it.

original: gang zag 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa ste zhes bya ba nas gang zag 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa ste zhes bya ba nas gang zag 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: “This person is established in the wishless” up to “This person is an arhat.”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang bshad pa'i don snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang bshad pa'i don snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure eye of Dharma.”

original: khyad par du smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: khyad par du smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
translated: In particular, they abide in the samadhi of absence of expectancy and attain the state of a stream enterer.🔽

original: dgra bcom pa'i bar du thob par byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i bar du thob par byed pa tsam du zad de /
translated: In particular, they abide in the concentration of absence of expectancy and merely attain the state of stream enterer up to the state of arhat.

original: de lta bu shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi spyan yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi spyan yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: To know this is the Dharma eye of the bodhisattvas.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, Shariputra, whatever is a phenomenon that arises

original: kun 'byung ba'i chos can de dag thams cad ni 'gag pa'i chos can no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i chos can de dag thams cad ni 'gag pa'i chos can no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: all of those are phenomena that cease.

original: 'di ni sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes @77b bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: 'di ni sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes @77b bya ba'i bar du /
translated: Shariputra, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure Dharma eye.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba'i chos can gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'gag pa'i chos can du shes pas dbang po lnga la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu shes pa yang /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba'i chos can gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'gag pa'i chos can du shes pas dbang po lnga la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu shes pa yang /
translated: This is how the five powers and so forth are attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ completely pure eye of Dharma.

original: kun 'byung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “the basis for the arising of phenomena” means “the basis for the arising of qualities.”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi mig gis /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi mig gis /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, the bodhisattva great beings, with the eye of Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni sems dang po bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni sems dang po bskyed pa ste /
translated: see this bodhisattva great being who has generated the first level of the mind

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and who is practicing the perfection of generosity.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / yon tan shes pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / yon tan shes pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This explains the knowledge of the bodhisattva’s conduct and qualities on the first ground.

original: shes pa de lta bu yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de lta bu yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: “Such knowledge is the purity of a bodhisattva’s Dharma eye.”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, a bodhisattva great being

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: knows the following about a bodhisattva great being: ‘This bodhisattva great being has been prophesied to unsurpassed and perfect awakening.’

original: de ltar na sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de ltar na sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, this is the purity of a bodhisattva great being’s Dharma eye.”

original: sa gnyis pa yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / spyod pa dang / yon tan rnams shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / spyod pa dang / yon tan rnams shes pa bstan te /
translated: The nature, conduct, and qualities of the bodhisattvas from the second ground onward are taught.

original: shes pa de lta bu yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de lta bu yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Such knowledge is the bodhisattvas’ completely pure eye of Dharma.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems kyi rjes la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems kyi rjes la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ vajra-like concentration that follows the mind of awakening.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, this is the completely pure eye of a buddha of the bodhisattva great beings’ unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan yongs su dag pa bstan pa @78a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan yongs su dag pa bstan pa @78a * //
translated: This teaches the bodhisattvas’ completely pure eye of a buddha.

original: ste sangs rgyas su ma gyur pa la /
analyzed: ste sangs rgyas su ma gyur pa la /
translated: and not yet become a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi yon tan de lta bu byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la yongs su sbyangs pa'i rgyus thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi yon tan de lta bu byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la yongs su sbyangs pa'i rgyus thob pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva called Buddha Eye, because of the cause of thoroughly training in the ten bodhisattva stages in the qualities of the Buddha eye,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya'o ;
translated: is called the bodhisattva Buddha Eye.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig lnga yongs su sbyang bar 'dod pa dang thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig lnga yongs su sbyang bar 'dod pa dang thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, thus bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to train in and attain the five eyes, from the beginning should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig lnga po de dag la bslab pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: mig lnga po de dag la bslab pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who train in those five eyes

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyan lnga po de dag thob pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pas thob po zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyan lnga po de dag thob pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pas thob po zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The attainment of those five eyes of the bodhisattva is taught to be attained by practicing the six perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du spyan lnga la sogs pa dge pa'i chos thams cad 'dus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du spyan lnga la sogs pa dge pa'i chos thams cad 'dus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: Why is that? and so on teaches the reason why all virtuous dharmas such as the five eyes and so on are included within the six perfections.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu la la zhig yang dag par smra bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bo yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu la la zhig yang dag par smra bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bo yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement Śāradvatī­putra, someone who speaks correctly, and so on teaches that within the six perfections, the perfection of wisdom is foremost.

original: su zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus so zhes smra ba de ni yang dag par smra ba'am bden par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: su zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus so zhes smra ba de ni yang dag par smra ba'am bden par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that whoever says that all virtuous dharmas are included within the perfection of wisdom is speaking correctly or speaking the truth.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu 'thob ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu 'thob ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom attain the perfection of superknowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: They perfect the six superknowledges.🔽They progress to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the six superknowledges of bodhisattvas.

original: sngar mngon par shes pa bshad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par shes pa ste mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngar mngon par shes pa bshad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par shes pa ste mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The earlier explanation of the superknowledges was the superknowledges of the Tathāgata, which was a brief explanation.

original: skabs 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa bstan pa ste rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa bstan pa ste rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: Here, the explanation of the superknowledges of bodhisattvas is an extensive explanation.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @78b phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @78b phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing zhes bya ba nas /🔽'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sa'i rim pa la mthon dman dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing zhes bya ba nas / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sa'i rim pa la mthon dman dang /
translated: they abide in the transcendent perfection of generosity, and so on, up to:🔽they purify the path to omniscience by apprehending the absence of coming and the absence of going, and by apprehending the absence of grasping.

original: spyod pa rgya che chung gi bye brag las pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: spyod pa rgya che chung gi bye brag las pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yang yod /
translated: Some bodhisattvas, on account of the differences in the levels of the stages, the extent of their conduct, and the extent of their transcendent perfections, perfect all six transcendent perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gcig gam /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gcig gam /
translated: Some perfect one,

original: gnyis sam gsum la sogs pa rdzogs par byed pa yang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum la sogs pa rdzogs par byed pa yang yod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: two, three, or more of the transcendent perfections.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the emptiness of the beyond of extremes.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa la bya ste /🔽don dam par dngos po yod par yang sgro mi 'dogs la /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa la bya ste / don dam par dngos po yod par yang sgro mi 'dogs la /
translated: This means that the two extremes of superimposition and denial are abandoned.🔽Because, ultimately, one does not superimpose existence,

original: kun rdzob tu med par yang skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu med par yang skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and, conventionally, one does not deny nonexistence.

original: chags pa med pa'i sems nye bar bzung bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i sems nye bar bzung bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the absence of attachment in the mind.

original: gtong ba po dang len pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i rdzas gsum char la dngos por lta zhing zhen pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtong ba po dang len pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i rdzas gsum char la dngos por lta zhing zhen pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the three—the giver, the recipient, and the substance to be given—are not seen as real entities and are not clung to.

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs shing skur pa 'debs pa med pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas sbyin pa byas na /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs shing skur pa 'debs pa med pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas sbyin pa byas na / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: Thus, when generosity is practiced without superimposition and denial, and with the complete purity of the three spheres,🔽it will purify the path to omniscience.

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su dag par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su dag par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it will purify the path to enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply this in the appropriate manner to the remaining perfections, such as morality.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in terms of the absence of coming and going

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam zhes bya ba smos pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam zhes bya ba smos pas /
translated: means that the path of omniscience is not a path.

original: lam yod pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang yod snyam du sems pa las bzlog pa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lam yod pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang yod snyam du sems pa las bzlog pa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase in terms of the absence of coming and going is stated in order to counteract the notion that there is a path and that there is coming and going.

original: chos thams cad ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa /
translated: All phenomena, when they arise, do not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa na yang gang du yang 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa na yang gang du yang 'gro ba med de /
translated: When they cease, they do not go anywhere.

original: de ltar 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par rtogs pa nyid byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽de la sbyin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so @79a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par rtogs pa nyid byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o // de la sbyin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so @79a * //
translated: Thus, the very realization of the absence of coming and going is the purification of the path to enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In this regard, it is stated: Generosity is designated in terms of the relinquishment of grasping.

original: shes rab ni shes rab 'chal pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: shes rab ni shes rab 'chal pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Wisdom is designated in dependence on the absence of stupidity.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams smos pa yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams smos pa yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The mention of the six perfections such as generosity is not ultimately real.

original: kun rdzob tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i zlas bsgrubs te btags pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i zlas bsgrubs te btags pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Generosity and so on are merely imputed in a relative sense, in contrast to their opposites such as stinginess.

original: de ni brgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: de ni brgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “I have crossed.”

original: ma brgal to zhes bya ba rlom sems med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma brgal to zhes bya ba rlom sems med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He does not think, “I have not crossed.”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spangs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spangs te /
translated: He does not think, “I have abandoned stinginess and so on, the opposites of generosity and so on,

original: de dag las thar to zhes bya bar mi sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag las thar to zhes bya bar mi sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and I have been liberated from them.”

original: ser sna la sogs pa de dag nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa de dag nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because stinginess and so on are not ultimately real.

original: sbyin pa byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “I am generous.”

original: sbyin pa mi byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There is no conceiving of I do not give up to I am not wise.

original: shes rab 'chal ba can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa drug car yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir de dag tu mi sems so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa drug car yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir de dag tu mi sems so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The six perfections such as generosity and the six such as stinginess that are their opposites are not conceived of as such because ultimately they are non-entities.

original: spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The passage beginning There is no conceiving of 'I have reviled'

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis ma gos par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis ma gos par bstan to //
translated: teaches that he is not defiled by the eight worldly concerns.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bum skyes pa ni spyos zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bum skyes pa ni spyos zhes bya bar rlom sems med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: Shāradvatī­putra, there is no conceiving of 'I have reviled' and so on teaches the reason for that.

original: spyo bar bya ba dang / spyo bar byed pa dang / spyo ba'i dngos po gsum char don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir de ltar mi sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyo bar bya ba dang / spyo bar byed pa dang / spyo ba'i dngos po gsum char don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir de ltar mi sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not think in that way because the three—the one who is to be scolded, the one who is scolding, and the thing that is scolded—are ultimately non-arisen.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽rlom sems thams cad yang dag par gcod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni / rlom sems thams cad yang dag par gcod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom🔽is the cutting off of all conceit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems thams cad gcod pa'i don ston pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems thams cad gcod pa'i don ston pas /
translated: The meaning is that because the perfection of wisdom teaches the meaning of the cutting off of all conceit,

original: de la spyos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la de lta bu'i rlom sems mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la spyos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la de lta bu'i rlom sems mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the bodhisattva who is scolded in that way does not have that kind of conceit.

original: 'di la sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di la sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Here, Śāradvatī­putra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: yon @79b tan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: yon @79b tan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni /
translated: they have as many good qualities

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: as all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not have.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'og nas 'byung ba rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'og nas 'byung ba rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom do not have the qualities that are mentioned below, such as bringing beings to maturity and purifying the buddha-field, as do the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yon tan de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those qualities?

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From bringing beings to maturity up to purifying the buddha-field, and so on.

original: de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: One who practices like this will not fall away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: When this teaching of the perfection of wisdom was being taught, from at that time up to generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pas /
translated: This explains the teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can yongs su smin par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This explains the teaching of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Lord, at that time, smiled...

original: phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: ...in the future, there will appear in the world as many Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones named Alamkakusuma as there are atoms in the great trichiliocosm.

original: 'khor yongs su smin par 'gyur ba rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor yongs su smin par 'gyur ba rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa bshad pa'o //
translated: This explains the prediction of those in the retinue who will be matured to unsurpassed enlightenment.🔽Then the Venerable Shariputra, the Venerable Mahamaudgalyayana...

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal chen po'i bu dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal chen po'i bu dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, and so on,🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thub pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thub pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that cannot be overcome.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan bsngags shing bstod pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan bsngags shing bstod pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, the praise and eulogy of the qualities of the perfection of wisdom🔽is complete.

original: rab dang mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rab dang mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The words “excellent,” “supreme,” and so on

original: bzang bar bstod pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: bzang bar bstod pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: are simply synonyms for “good.”

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: have given the gift that is equal to the unequaled.

original: rigs kyi bu dag de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽sems can thams cad la @80a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni / sems can thams cad la @80a * //
translated: Sons of noble family, therefore the bodhisattva great beings🔽are engaged in the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Up to this point,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan bsngags pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan bsngags pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the praise of the virtues of the bodhisattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase they have given the gift that is equal to the unequalled means

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa sngar yongs su btang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa sngar yongs su btang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that they have previously given the gift that is pure of the three spheres.

original: yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase they give means

original: da lta'i dus na 'khor gsum yongs su dag par gtong ba'o //
analyzed: da lta'i dus na 'khor gsum yongs su dag par gtong ba'o //
translated: that they give the gift that is pure of the three spheres in the present.

original: yongs su gtang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su gtang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase they will give means

original: phyis yongs su gtang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyis yongs su gtang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that they will give the gift that is pure of the three spheres in the future.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te yongs su rdzogs so //🔽yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te yongs su rdzogs so //🔽yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of generosity that is equal to the unequalled is completed, has been completed, and will be completed.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ba dang / gtong ba dang gtang bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dus gsum du sbyar te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ba dang / gtong ba dang gtang bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dus gsum du sbyar te bstan pa'o //
translated: The giving of unequalled gifts, the giving of gifts that are to be given, and the result of giving that is to be given, are applied to the three times and taught.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so it is with the perfection of morality, etc.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: One attains a form that is unequalled, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po dang mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po dang mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: The five aggregates of form, feeling, etc. of the Tathagata are unequalled to the aggregates of the mundane, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mi mnyam pa de lta bu dang mnyam pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa de lta bu dang mnyam pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: One attains an equality with that inequality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa blta bas mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa blta bas mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: The form of the Tathagata is adorned with the major and minor marks, and is never satiated to look at.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal du bral ba'i tshor ba btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal du bral ba'i tshor ba btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: Feeling is the neutral feeling of being free from pleasure and pain.

original: 'du byed ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa med pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa med pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: Formations are the spontaneous, effortless formations of virtue, nonvirtue, and the ethically neutral.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pa ye shes lhun gyis grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pa ye shes lhun gyis grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Consciousness is the spontaneous, effortless nature of wisdom that does not cause the perception of objects.

original: de lta bu'i phung po lnga ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa su la yang med pas mi mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phung po lnga ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa su la yang med pas mi mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since such five aggregates do not exist for anyone, whether worldly beings or hearers and solitary realizers, they are called “unequal.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: phung po lnga mi mnyam pa de lta bu @80b dang mnyam pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po lnga mi mnyam pa de lta bu @80b dang mnyam pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: attain equality with those five unequal aggregates.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: Alternatively, the Thus-Gone One is the dharmakāya.

original: don dam par phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam par phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Ultimately, he is not the nature of the five aggregates.

original: phung po lngas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: phung po lngas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: For those sentient beings who are to be guided by the five aggregates,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus phung po lngar bstan to /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus phung po lngar bstan to /
translated: the Enjoyment and Emanation Bodies are taught as the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga po de dag kyang mtshan nyid 'di kho na yin no zhes sus kyang thog tu mi phebs shing /
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag kyang mtshan nyid 'di kho na yin no zhes sus kyang thog tu mi phebs shing /
translated: And those five aggregates are such that no one can say, “Their characteristics are just this.”

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mi mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mi mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is inconceivable is called “unequalled.”

original: mi mnyam pa de lta bu thob par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa de lta bu thob par 'gyur ba la /
translated: And in attaining that kind of equality,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o//
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o//
translated: one attains form, feeling, etc., which are equal to the unequalled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub tu mngon par byang chub nas /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub tu mngon par byang chub nas /
translated: Having attained enlightenment which is equal to the unequalled,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one turns the wheel of the unequalled Dharma.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par byang chub nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par byang chub nas /
translated: Having attained the unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes bstan to //
translated: one turns the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /
translated: If there are bodhisattva great beings,

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: the human world will appear in the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: In this way, the reason for praising the qualities of the bodhisattvas is taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / spyod du bcug pas de'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mtho ris dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /🔽yang dag par bral ba'i bde ba yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / spyod du bcug pas de'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mtho ris dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste / yang dag par bral ba'i bde ba yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The result of the bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom themselves and causing others to practice it is the appearance of the perfect happiness of the higher realms and of nirvana, which are mundane and supramundane, respectively.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ka dang legs par bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ka dang legs par bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “or the happiness of complete separation” refers to the fact that at the time of nirvana, one is completely separated from both the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid la yang dag par bral ba bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid la yang dag par bral ba bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And the cessation of suffering is called “happiness.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Lord, at that time, extended his tongue,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu'i le'u la thug gi bar du 'od 'phro ba dgye ba mdzad de /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu'i le'u la thug gi bar du 'od 'phro ba dgye ba mdzad de /
translated: and emitted light rays from his mouth, up to the chapter of Śāradvatī­putra.

original: sngar 'od 'phro ba bkye bas 'khor bsdus pa rnams kyi lhag ma rnams 'od 'phro 'dis bsdus nas yongs su smin par byas te lung bstan pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sngar 'od 'phro ba bkye bas 'khor bsdus pa rnams kyi lhag ma rnams 'od 'phro 'dis bsdus nas yongs su smin par byas te lung bstan pa bshad pa'o //
translated: Previously, the light rays gathered the remaining retinue, and through this light rays they were ripened and received predictions. This explains the prediction.

original: de yan chad du ni gang gi phyir brtson par bya ba dang / ji ltar @81a * //
analyzed: de yan chad du ni gang gi phyir brtson par bya ba dang / ji ltar @81a * //
translated: From here on, the reason for striving,

original: brtson par bya ba dang / brtson par byad pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / brtson par byed pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams /
analyzed: brtson par bya ba dang / brtson par byad pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / brtson par byed pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams /
translated: how to strive, the characteristics of those who strive, and the classifications of those who strive,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa dang / sha ra dva ti'i bus gleng bslang ste zhus pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa dang / sha ra dva ti'i bus gleng bslang ste zhus pa bstan zin to //
translated: were explained by the Lord and requested by Śāradvatī­putra. This teaches the introduction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las sh'a ri'i bu'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las sh'a ri'i bu'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter, concerning Shariputra, in this Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, a commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / da ni brtson pa la gdams pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni brtson pa la gdams pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the advice on diligence will be explained.

original: brtson pa la gdams pa de yang 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis zhus te bshad pa /
analyzed: brtson pa la gdams pa de yang 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis zhus te bshad pa /
translated: This advice on diligence was requested and explained by the noble Subhuti.

original: sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba mang du yod par gzigs nas ;
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba mang du yod par gzigs nas ;
translated: Seeing that there are many beings to be fully ripened,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtsom ste /🔽ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtsom ste / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba /
translated: then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhuti:🔽Subhuti, you should generate eloquence to speak about the Dharma in such a way that the bodhisattva mahasattvas will engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam bya bar spobs pa skyed cig ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam bya bar spobs pa skyed cig ces bka' stsal te /
translated: In such a way that the bodhisattva mahasattvas will emerge from the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase will come forth from the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing de'i don rtogs pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing de'i don rtogs pas /
translated: means that by practicing the perfection of wisdom and realizing its meaning,

original: go 'phang mthon por 'gyur ba la 'byung ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: go 'phang mthon por 'gyur ba la 'byung ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: one will attain the exalted state.

original: / chos kyi gtam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / chos kyi gtam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the discourse on the Dharma

original: brtson pa la gdams pa'i chos bshad pa 'og nas 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: brtson pa la gdams pa'i chos bshad pa 'og nas 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: refers to the Dharma teachings on the instructions for striving that will be given below.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos nyan pa'i 'khor byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa de dag 'di snyam du gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di nyan thos yin pas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos nyan pa'i 'khor byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa de dag 'di snyam du gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di nyan thos yin pas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva great beings, the great hearers, and the sons of the gods thought, This elder Subhūti is a hearer.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos rnams shes pa tsam du zad na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos rnams shes pa tsam du zad na /
translated: He knows only the Dharma of the Hearers' Vehicle,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po'i chos kyi gtam byed du bcug pa 'di rang gi blos ston tam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po'i chos kyi gtam byed du bcug pa 'di rang gi blos ston tam /
translated: This is the teaching of the doubt as to whether the Bhagavat has the discourse of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle taught by his own mind,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ston snyam du the tshom za ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ston snyam du the tshom za ba bstan pa'o //
translated: or whether it is taught by the empowerment of the Tathagata.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, the venerable Subhuti, through the power of the Buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
translated: to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs @81b rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs @81b rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: is not the domain of all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'khor rnams kyi rtog pa sems kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'khor rnams kyi rtog pa sems kyis rtogs nas /
translated: The elder Subhuti, having understood with his mind the thoughts of the assembly,

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi gtam bya ba 'di ni bdag gi shes rab dang spobs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: explained that this discourse of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle is not his own wisdom and eloquence,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus ston to zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus ston to zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: but is taught through the empowerment and power of the Tathagata.

analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po yin te /
translated: The elder Subhūti is a great bodhisattva.

analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa /
translated: He has accumulated the accumulations of merit and wisdom for countless eons.

original: chos zab mo la bzod pa thob pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: chos zab mo la bzod pa thob pa yin mod kyi /
translated: He has attained the acceptance of the profound Dharma.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas shing dge slong gi tshul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas shing dge slong gi tshul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshul du bstan pas bdag nyid kyi tshig yin pa skad byas nas /

analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na kha cig ma gus shing ma dad par 'gyur du dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, fearing that some in the assembly would be disrespectful and have no faith,

analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yin gyi /
translated: he says, “This is the word of the Bhagavat,

original: bdag gi tshig ma yin no zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: bdag gi tshig ma yin no zhes bstan to ;
translated: not my own words.”

translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, it is the Tathāgata himself who teaches the perfection of wisdom by skillful means to the bodhisattva great beings.”

analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus /
translated: In this way, through the blessing and power of the Tathagata,

analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi gtam byed du bcug pa nyid la thabs kyis ston pa mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said that the Lord skillfully teaches Subhuti to speak about the Dharma.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gdams pa bzhi'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: What is the meaning of the words 'form and formless'?🔽What is the meaning

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: Blessed One, what is called a bodhisattva🔽

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba de lta bu bdag gis yang dag par rjes su mi mthong @82a * //

analyzed: ngo  zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, I do not see any bodhisattva or perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba don dam par dmigs su med na su zhig gang la gdams par bya zhes zhus pa'o //

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste ;

analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba stong par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /

translated: The conceptualization of things as discordant is
