translated: With regard to the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, the eighteen elements, contact that arises from the assembly of elements, and the feelings that arise from contact,🔽the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas conceive of the factors that are discordant with and the factors that are antidotes to those as real things.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad @84a * //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad @84a * //
translated: But this does not occur for the bodhisattvas, who understand that all phenomena are mere designations.

original: btags pa tsam du rtogs shing /🔽brtson pa la 'doms pa rnams la mi 'byung bar bstan pa yang /
analyzed: btags pa tsam du rtogs shing / brtson pa la 'doms pa rnams la mi 'byung bar bstan pa yang /
translated: This is taught by the following:

original: tshor ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “He does not see anything that could be called ‘feeling’ . . .

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de 'dus byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de 'dus byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see that perfection of wisdom, that bodhisattva, or the name of a bodhisattva as existing in the compounded element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan te /
translated: They do not see them as existing in the uncompounded element.

original: ji ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: As explained above, just as in the case of phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres, the bodhisattvas do not conceive of them as being the counteragents or the remedies.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang kun rdzob tu brda dang / tha snyad tsam du btags te brtson pa la 'doms kyi /🔽don dam par ni de dag kyang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i khams na yod pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang kun rdzob tu brda dang / tha snyad tsam du btags te brtson pa la 'doms kyi / don dam par ni de dag kyang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i khams na yod pa'am /
translated: The perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of the bodhisattva are all merely conventional designations and mere conventions.🔽In the ultimate, however, the conception that they exist in the compounded and uncompounded elements,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: or that they exist as the nature of the compounded and uncompounded does not occur.🔽This is the meaning.

original: / rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: It is because when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: they do not conceive of or think about any of those phenomena.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar du /
translated: up to: “one should understand the designation of phenomena as names and symbols.”

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the reason why conceptualization does not arise is taught.

original: chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ste zhes  bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ste zhes  bya ba ni /
translated: “He does not conceptualize or discriminate those phenomena”

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa gong du smos pa'i chos de dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i dngos por mi rtog cing rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa gong du smos pa'i chos de dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i dngos por mi rtog cing rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that he does not conceptualize or discriminate those phenomena such as the aggregates and constituents mentioned above as being the antidotes to their discordant classes.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas shing /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas shing /
translated: “When he practices the perfection of wisdom, he abides in the nonconceptual Dharma

original: @84b dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @84b dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and practices the perfection of wisdom in order to cultivate the applications of mindfulness.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de don dam par chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de don dam par chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Because that bodhisattva does not see any phenomena ultimately,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas nas kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ming dang brda tsam du gdags pas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas nas kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ming dang brda tsam du gdags pas /
translated: he abides in the nonconceptual Dharma and, in order to ripen sentient beings conventionally, he designates them with mere names and symbols.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he practices the perfection of wisdom in order to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Apart from the attention on omniscience, he does not see even the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na yang /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na yang /
translated: Thus, when he practices the perfection of wisdom in order to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba tsam zhig yid la bya ba ma gtogs par /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba tsam zhig yid la bya ba ma gtogs par /
translated: except for the mere keeping in mind of the attainment of the knowledge of all modes in the conventional sense.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa don dam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa don dam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom, etc. as really existing in the ultimate sense.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa nas /
translated: In the same way, he should apply the meditation on the right efforts,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad bsgom pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad bsgom pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: up to the meditation on the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: he has fully understood the dharmic mark of dharmas.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa don dam par yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba nyid chos rnams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid legs par rtogs shing khong du chud pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa don dam par yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba nyid chos rnams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid legs par rtogs shing khong du chud pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the very non-seeing of the perfection of wisdom, etc. in the ultimate is the thorough understanding and comprehension of the characteristic of the ultimate of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of phenomena is not defiled.

original: so so'i skye bo'i tshe yang nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i tshe yang nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Nor is it purified. The thorough understanding of the characteristic of the ultimate of phenomena is not defiled when one is an ordinary being,

original: 'phags pa'i tshe yang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshe yang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and it is not purified when one is a noble being,

original: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because suchness does not change into something else.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod @85a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod @85a * //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: pa'i tshe / ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa'i tshe / ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: they should understand the designation of phenomena that are to be labeled with names and symbols.”

original: de ltar brtson pa la gdams pa'i yon tan mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa la gdams pa'i yon tan mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the conclusion of the teaching on the benefits of striving in that way.

original: don dam par chos thams cad mi dmigs shing brjod du med kyang /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad mi dmigs shing brjod du med kyang /
translated: Although ultimately all phenomena are not observed and are inexpressible,

original: kun rdzob tu ming brda tsam du gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste brtson pa la gdams par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ming brda tsam du gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste brtson pa la gdams par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: they should understand the designation that is merely a name and symbol on the conventional level. This is the teaching on the instruction for striving.

original: de ltar des ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa khong du chud nas /
analyzed: de ltar des ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos su gdags pa khong du chud nas /
translated: “In that way, having understood the designation of phenomena that are to be labeled with names and symbols,

original: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la chags par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: they will not become attached to form, and so on, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la chags par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: they will not become attached to purifying a buddhafield.”

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad du gdags te brtson ba  la gdams pa byed kyang /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad du gdags te brtson ba  la gdams pa byed kyang /
translated: Thus, although one is advised to make effort in the conventional, in terms of mere nominal and conventional designations,

original: don dam par chos gang yang rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos gang yang rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: ultimately one does not see any phenomena at all.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la chags par mi 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la chags par mi 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: This shows that one does not become attached to the world of form and so forth, nor to any supramundane phenomena, as a result of abiding in nonconceptuality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang chags par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang chags par byed pa'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because there are no phenomena whatsoever that could be attached to,🔽by which one could be attached,

original: gang gis chags par bya ba'am /🔽gang la chags par bya ba de lta bu'i chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis chags par bya ba'am / gang la chags par bya ba de lta bu'i chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or that one could be attached to.

original: de ltar chags par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chags par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the reason why one does not become attached.

original: gang chags par byed pa'i ming dang gang gis chags par 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags dang / gang la chags par bya ba'i dngos po de dag thams cad don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang chags par byed pa'i ming dang gang gis chags par 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags dang / gang la chags par bya ba'i dngos po de dag thams cad don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: because the name by which one is attached, the attachment by which one becomes attached, and the thing to which one is attached, all of these ultimately do not exist.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: increases the perfection of generosity, and so on up to

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he attains the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: He attains the samādhi gateways.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la ma chags par spyad pa'i 'bras bu pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi chos rnams thob par 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la ma chags par spyad pa'i 'bras bu pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi chos rnams thob par 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, the result of practicing without attachment to any phenomena is the attainment of the qualities of the bodhisattva, such as the perfections.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ming dang brdar @85b bya ba'i chos su gdags pa rnams de ltar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming dang brdar @85b bya ba'i chos su gdags pa rnams de ltar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: should understand all phenomena designated by names and conventional terms in that way.

original: chos rnams ming dang brdar tha snyad du btags te brtson pa la gdams pa mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ming dang brdar tha snyad du btags te brtson pa la gdams pa mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This concludes the teaching on the instruction for diligently engaging in the conventional designation of phenomena by names and conventional terms.

original: de ltar btags pa'i gdams pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar btags pa'i gdams pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the instruction on such designations,

original: da ni sems can mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sems can mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: now the instruction on the non-apprehension of sentient beings will be taught.

original: de yang gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis brtson pa la gdams pa dang po zhus pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis brtson pa la gdams pa dang po zhus pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when the elder Subhūti first requested the instruction for the diligent ones,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes smos te zhus pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes smos te zhus pa la /
translated: he said bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: 'khor rnams kyi nang na kha cig byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dngos po yod do snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor rnams kyi nang na kha cig byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dngos po yod do snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Among the assembly, some had doubts, thinking bodhisattva is a real thing. To dispel that,

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na zhes smras pa de la /
translated: Subhūti, you said, Blessed One, you say 'bodhisattva, bodhisattva.'

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response, the Buddha said, Subhūti, what do you think? and so forth.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba sems can gyi dngos por yod par 'dzin na /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba sems can gyi dngos por yod par 'dzin na /
translated: If one grasps at what is called bodhisattva as if it were an entity of sentient beings,

original: mu stegs can gyis btags pa'i bdag la sogs pa bzhin du yod par rtog na rnam par rtog pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis btags pa'i bdag la sogs pa bzhin du yod par rtog na rnam par rtog pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: if one conceives of it as existing like the self and so on imputed by tīrthikas, then there would be three conceptual thoughts:

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid dam /
translated: conceiving of it as form and so on,

original: de las gzhan par rtog pa dang / gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos por rtog pa dang / de dag gang la yang ma gtogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan par rtog pa dang / gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos por rtog pa dang / de dag gang la yang ma gtogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: conceiving of it as a basis or abode, and conceiving of it as an entity that is not included in any of those.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /🔽gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: In order to dispel those, the Buddha said, Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Is form a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is something other than form a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva in form?🔽Is form in the bodhisattva?

translated: The passage from The name 'bodhisattva' is not apprehended up to The name 'form' is not apprehended explains the instruction on not apprehending the basis.🔽The passage from The name 'bodhisattva' is not apprehended up to The name 'nirvāṇa' is not apprehended

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i tshig bla dgas dang / gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga po de dag nyid la rtag pa @87b la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhir 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dgas dang / phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhir 'dogs ba'i tshig bla dgas dang /
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i tshig bla dgas dang / gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga po de dag nyid la rtag pa @87b la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhir 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dgas dang / phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhir 'dogs ba'i tshig bla dgas dang /
translated: Furthermore, the term “five aggregates” is a designation for the five aggregates of form and so on, and the term “five aggregates of form and so on” is a designation for the four errors of permanence and so on imputed to those five aggregates of form and so on, and the term “four errors of permanence and so on” is a designation for the four antidotes of impermanence and so on imputed to those five aggregates of form and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa gsum du 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dgas dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi stong pa la sogs pa gsum du 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dgas mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa gsum du 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dgas dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi stong pa la sogs pa gsum du 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dgas mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: The term “four antidotes of impermanence and so on” is a designation for the three doors of liberation of emptiness and so on, and the term “three doors of liberation of emptiness and so on” is a designation for the three non-doors of liberation of non-emptiness and so on.🔽Thus the non-observation of those is taught.

original: de la rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Is the term “bodhisattva” a designation for form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Subhūti, do you think that the word ‘bodhisattva’ is a designation for the consciousness that is wishless?”🔽The Blessed One asked, “Subhūti, do you think that the word ‘bodhisattva’ is a designation for form, and so on?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig bla dgas yin snyam du sems sam zhes dris pa dang / rab 'byor gyis don dam par tshig bla dgas mi dmigs par rtogs nas de ltar mi sems so zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig bla dgas yin snyam du sems sam zhes dris pa dang / rab 'byor gyis don dam par tshig bla dgas mi dmigs par rtogs nas de ltar mi sems so zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One, having realized that ultimately a designation is not apprehended, I do not think in that way.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, if form does not exist and is not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: how could the word ‘bodhisattva’ be a designation for form?

original: bcom ldan 'das smon pa med pa shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das smon pa med pa shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na ;
translated: Subhūti, if the wishless does not exist and is not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: how could the word ‘bodhisattva’ be a designation for the consciousness that is wishless?”

original: rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam par tshig bla dgas kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam par tshig bla dgas kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti taught the reason why the bodhisattva is not an entity that exists as a designation in an ultimate sense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva himself does not exist in an ultimate sense,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang / de dag gi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid kyang dngos por med cing de dag tu gdags pa'i tshig bla dgas kyang yod pa don dam par rang bzhin gyis ma grub bas de dag byang chub sems dpar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang / de dag gi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid kyang dngos por med cing de dag tu gdags pa'i tshig bla dgas kyang yod pa don dam par rang bzhin gyis ma grub bas de dag byang chub sems dpar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
translated: and form, etc., and their states of permanence, impermanence, etc. are not entities, and the designations that designate them do not exist ultimately, because they are not established by intrinsic reality. Therefore, they are not bodhisattvas.

original: to // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: to // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, Subhūti, excellent!

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba'i @88a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba'i @88a * //
translated: they do not apprehend the designation of form,

original: tshig bla dgas mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshig bla dgas mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from “the non-apprehension of the designation of the eye” up to

original: rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: “the non-apprehension of the designation of consciousness as having aspirations” is the instruction on the non-apprehension of the designation.

original: tshig bla dgas dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs rab 'byor gyis bshad pa mnyes par bstod nas /
analyzed: tshig bla dgas dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs rab 'byor gyis bshad pa mnyes par bstod nas /
translated: Having praised Subhūti’s explanation of the reason for the non-apprehension of the designation,

original: tshig bla dgas mi dmigs par gdams pa'i mjug bsdus te /
analyzed: tshig bla dgas mi dmigs par gdams pa'i mjug bsdus te /
translated: he concludes the instruction on the non-apprehension of the designation.

original: de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //🔽rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du bdag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du bdag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: “Thus should one train” teaches the conclusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: “Subhūti, you said, ‘I do not see that dharma called “bodhisattva,”’ and so on.

original: rab 'byor gyis dang por zhus pa'i tshig bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlas te bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis dang por zhus pa'i tshig bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlas te bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One repeats and answers the words that Subhūti first asked about.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba la gleng bslang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba la gleng bslang ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should not see the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig don dam par mi dmigs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig don dam par mi dmigs par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only the bodhisattva is not ultimately seen,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang /
translated: but all mundane and supramundane dharmas🔽are not ultimately seen.

original: don dam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes chos thams cad mi dmigs par gdams pa bstan to //🔽de la chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo ;
analyzed: don dam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes chos thams cad mi dmigs par gdams pa bstan to // de la chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo ;
translated: This teaches the instruction on the non-apprehension of all dharmas.🔽There, the dharma does not see the dharma-realm.

original: / chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The dharma-realm does not see the dharma.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob brtags pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob brtags pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Dharma refers to the conventional imputed dharmas.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The dharma-realm refers to

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos de don dam par kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis ka stong pa'i ngo bo nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos de don dam par kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis ka stong pa'i ngo bo nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: the perfected dharma. Ultimately, both the imputed and the perfected are of one taste in the essence of emptiness.

original: tha dad du dbyer med pas gcig gis gcig mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad du dbyer med pas gcig gis gcig mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that they do not see each other because they are not divided into different parts.🔽Subhūti, the realm of phenomena does not see the realm of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams so sor phye nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams so sor phye nas /
translated: This and the other passages teach that, having distinguished the phenomena of form and so on,

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: all phenomena are not observed.

original: gzugs kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called realm of form

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of imputed form.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called realm of phenomena

original: yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: is the nature of fully present form.

original: de gnyis gcig gis gcig mi mthong @88b pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //🔽gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de gnyis gcig gis gcig mi mthong @88b pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no // gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That the two do not see each other is as explained above.🔽Just as with form, you should understand that this is the case

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: with feeling and so on, up to and including the realm of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the realm of the conditioned does not see the realm of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The realm of the unconditioned does not see the realm of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bsdus ta spyir mi dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bsdus ta spyir mi dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that in general, all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are included and not observed.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyi ga yang don dam par rang bzhin dbyer med pas /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyi ga yang don dam par rang bzhin dbyer med pas /
translated: Since both the conditioned and the unconditioned are ultimately inseparable,

original: gcig gis gcig mi mthong ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽'dus byas kyi dbyings ma yin par yang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings rab tu gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig mi mthong ba ni snga ma bzhin no // 'dus byas kyi dbyings ma yin par yang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings rab tu gdags par mi nus so //
translated: one does not see the other, as explained above.🔽The realm of the unconditioned cannot be designated as the realm of the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ma yin pa yang 'dus byas kyi dbyings rab tu gdags par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ma yin pa yang 'dus byas kyi dbyings rab tu gdags par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The realm of the conditioned cannot be designated as the realm of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyi ga don dam par ro gcig pas /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyi ga don dam par ro gcig pas /
translated: This teaches that ultimately the conditioned and the unconditioned are of one taste.

original: 'dus byas ma gtogs par 'dus ma byas logs shig tu gdags su yang mi rung la /
analyzed: 'dus byas ma gtogs par 'dus ma byas logs shig tu gdags su yang mi rung la /
translated: It is not possible to designate the unconditioned apart from the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas ma gtogs par 'dus byas logs shig tu gdags su yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de bzhin nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa las yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe ni 'dus byas zhes gdags /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma gtogs par 'dus byas logs shig tu gdags su yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa las yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe ni 'dus byas zhes gdags /
translated: and it is not possible to designate the conditioned apart from the unconditioned.🔽The meaning is that.

original: yongs su dag pa'i tshe ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes gdags te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i tshe ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes gdags te /
translated: When it is completely impure, it is designated as conditioned.🔽When it is completely pure, it is designated as unconditioned.

original: dper na chu'i dngos por gcig pa las rnyog ma can gyi tshe ni chu ma dangs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dper na chu'i dngos por gcig pa las rnyog ma can gyi tshe ni chu ma dangs pa zhes bya /
translated: For example, when it is turbid, it is called “unclear water.”

original: phyis rnyog ma med par gyur pa'i tshe ni chu dangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyis rnyog ma med par gyur pa'i tshe ni chu dangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When it is later free from turbidity, it is called “clear water.”

original: chu'i rang bzhin la tha dad par gdags su mi rung ba bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i rang bzhin la tha dad par gdags su mi rung ba bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is not possible to designate the nature of water as different.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any dharma at all.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mi 'jigs mi dngang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mi 'jigs mi dngang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Since he does not see any dharma, he is not afraid, does not panic, and so on.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the benefits of the result, the realization that all dharmas are unobservable.

original: phan yon de yang dad pa che ba dang shes rab rno bar 'gyur ro //🔽dad pa che bas ni chos zab me bshad pa dang / shin tu bya dka' ba bsgrub pa dang / @89a * //
analyzed: phan yon de yang dad pa che ba dang shes rab rno bar 'gyur ro // dad pa che bas ni chos zab me bshad pa dang / shin tu bya dka' ba bsgrub pa dang / @89a * //
translated: And that benefit is that one’s faith becomes greater and one’s wisdom sharper.🔽Because of one’s greater faith, one is not afraid, does not panic, and is not terrified by the teachings of the profound Dharma, by the practice of what is very difficult to do,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rnams la ma dad pa'i dbang gis 'jigs pa dang dngang ba dang skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rnams la ma dad pa'i dbang gis 'jigs pa dang dngang ba dang skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and by the very amazing and marvelous qualities of a Buddha, because of a lack of faith.🔽Because of one’s sharper wisdom, one’s mind does not become timid or regretful with regard to the profound, what is difficult to do,

original: shes rab rno bas ni zab pa dang bya dka' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rnams la /
analyzed: shes rab rno bas ni zab pa dang bya dka' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rnams la /
translated: and the very amazing and marvelous qualities of a Buddha.

original: sems zhum pa dang yid 'gyod par mi 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: sems zhum pa dang yid 'gyod par mi 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Why is it so, Subhuti?

original: de chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Because he does not review any dharma, therefore he does not tremble, is not frightened or terrified.

original: de ltar skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de ltar skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This shows the reason why he does not tremble, etc.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de nyid zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de nyid zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: It also shows in detail that very nonapprehension of all dharmas.

original: de yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams smos pas ni phyi nang gi chos rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: de yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams smos pas ni phyi nang gi chos rnams bsdus so //
translated: And that is done by mentioning the aggregates, elements, sense fields, and members of dependent origination, which include all internal and external dharmas.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams smos pas ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams smos pas ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams bsdus so //
translated: By mentioning greed, hatred, and delusion, it includes all dharmas belonging to the side of affliction.

original: bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa smos pas ni mu stegs can gyis bdag tu btags pa sna tshogs btags pa tsam du yod pa rnams pa sdus so //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa smos pas ni mu stegs can gyis bdag tu btags pa sna tshogs btags pa tsam du yod pa rnams pa sdus so //
translated: By mentioning self, sentient being, living being, etc., it includes all the various imputations of self by the heterodox, which exist merely as imputations.

original: khams gsum smos pas ni 'khor bar gtogs pa'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: khams gsum smos pas ni 'khor bar gtogs pa'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: By mentioning the three realms, all phenomena belonging to cyclic existence are included.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams smos pas ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams smos pas ni /
translated: By mentioning the noble ones, such as the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and the noble dharmas,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad bsdus te /
translated: all the pure dharmas belonging to the side of purification are included.

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi 'jigs mi skrag go zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, by not seeing any mundane or supramundane phenomena, because the cause for being frightened and terrified is not observed, he is not frightened and does not become terrified.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

translated: The fetter of views is the four remaining

original: mdud pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /🔽chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang / lta ba bsnyems pa ste /🔽nyon mongs pa 'di rnams kyis sems can rnams grol thar par mi 'gyur bar 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir mdud pa zhes bya'o //

original: nye bar len pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //🔽lta ba nye bar len pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so // lta ba nye bar len pa ni /

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang bzhi'o /

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa nye bar len pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa nye bar len pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //

original: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni /🔽bdag gi lus la bdag go zhes smra ba'am /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni / bdag gi lus la bdag go zhes smra ba'am /

original: nga'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal la bya ste /
analyzed: nga'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal la bya ste /

original: nyon mongs pa 'di rnams kyis 'khor pa'i lus nye bar len par 'gyur ba'i phyir nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di rnams kyis 'khor pa'i lus nye bar len par 'gyur ba'i phyir nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These afflictions are called appropriations because they appropriate the body in cyclic existence.

original: phyin ci log bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four errors are as follows:

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar 'dzin pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar 'dzin pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa dang bzhi'o //
translated: To apprehend the impermanent as permanent, to apprehend suffering as happiness, to apprehend the impure as pure, and to apprehend the selfless as having a self.

original: mi dge ba bcu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ten nonvirtues are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par spyod pa ste /
translated: Killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct;🔽these three are physical. Lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle talk;🔽these four are verbal. Covetousness, malice, and wrong views;

original: lus kyi gsum dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma zer ba dang / tshig kyal pa dang / ngag rtsub mo ste ngag gi bzhi dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ste yid kyi gsum dang bcu'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gsum dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma zer ba dang / tshig kyal pa dang / ngag rtsub mo ste ngag gi bzhi dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ste yid kyi gsum dang bcu'o //

original: spang bar bya ba'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams la /

analyzed: zhes 'byung ba 'di dag yongs su rtogs par byas nas spang bar bya ba yin pas /

original: spang bar 'tshal bas zhes ma smos kyang spang bar bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar 'tshal bas zhes ma smos kyang spang bar bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: even though it is not stated, one should abandon, it should be understood that they are to be abandoned.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan rnams la yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas zhes ma smos kyang ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan rnams la yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas zhes ma smos kyang ;

original: yongs su rtogs par byas nas spang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs par byas nas spang bar rig par bya'o //

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos spang par bya ba rnams yongs su spangs par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos spang par bya ba rnams yongs su spangs par gyur pa ni /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pha la brtson pa'i phan yon yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /

translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to complete the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa gzhan rnams ni /
