original: las glengs te /
analyzed: las glengs te /
translated: Having thus spoken,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to extensively teach the great faults of the bodhisattva,

original: skabs 'dir logs shig tu phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dir logs shig tu phye ste bstan to //
translated: in this context, they are distinguished and taught separately.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yongs su rdzogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yongs su rdzogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa ste /
translated: By saying the roots of virtue that are perfected and so forth, the distinctive feature of perfecting the roots of virtue is taught.

original: ngan song rnams su mi ltung ba smos pas /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su mi ltung ba smos pas /
translated: By mentioning not falling into the lower realms,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rigs dma' bar mi skye ba smos pas nga rgyal bcag cing bla ma la rim gro dang / bkur sti byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi gnas pa smos pas chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen por mi ltung ba smos pas /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rigs dma' bar mi skye ba smos pas nga rgyal bcag cing bla ma la rim gro dang / bkur sti byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi gnas pa smos pas chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen por mi ltung ba smos pas /
translated: and the root of merit of realizing the selflessness of phenomena, as indicated by the statement that one does not abide on the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels,

original: thabs mkhas shing chos la mngon par chags pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: thabs mkhas shing chos la mngon par chags pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: and the root of merit of skillful means and being unattached to phenomena, as indicated by the statement that one does not fall into the great faults of a bodhisattva.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, one who wishes to perfect such roots of merit should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: In this way, the noble Shariputra

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po dri ba las gleng bslang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po dri ba las gleng bslang ste /
translated: raised the question about the great faults of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'khor rnams the tshom bsal ba dang / chos bshad pa zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor rnams the tshom bsal ba dang / chos bshad pa zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubts of the assembly and explain the Dharma in detail,

original: 'phags pa gnyis gcig gis dris pa'i lan gcig gis btab pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa gnyis gcig gis dris pa'i lan gcig gis btab pa ste /
translated: the two noble ones asked a question and answered it with a single reply.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la drod dang / rtse mo dang ; bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ces bya ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la drod dang / rtse mo dang ; bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ces bya ba /
translated: As for the so-called great faults of the bodhisattvas, on the level of devoted conduct, there are four: heat, peak, acceptance, and the supreme mundane state.

original: rnam pa bzhi las rtse mor gyur pa'i tshe na 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod cing /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi las rtse mor gyur pa'i tshe na 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod cing /
translated: When one reaches the peak, while practicing generosity and so forth with the three spheres not completely pure,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /
translated: one does not fall to the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yang thob par mi byed par bar ma dor gnas pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yang thob par mi byed par bar ma dor gnas pa ni /
translated: He does not even attain the first stage of the Bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called a Bodhisattva's great fault.

original: de bas na skyon chen por ltung ba gang yin zhes dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: de bas na skyon chen por ltung ba gang yin zhes dris pa'i lan du /
translated: Therefore, in answer to the question, What is a great fault?

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing zhes bya ba la @93b sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing zhes bya ba la @93b sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, When a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva practices the six perfections without skill in means... and so on.

original: de la chos la sred pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la chos la sred pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, craving for dharmas

original: chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: is grasping at the marks of dharmas.

original: de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that,

original: gzugs stong zhes bya bar mngon par chags shing gnas te 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya bar mngon par chags shing gnas te 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, They settle down and conceptualize 'form is empty,' and so on.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa smon pa med ces bya bar mngon par chags shing gnas te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa smon pa med ces bya bar mngon par chags shing gnas te /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is wishless and so on.

original: 'du shes pa 'di ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'du shes pa 'di ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: This conceptualization, Venerable Subhuti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams la stong pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams la stong pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: This is because when one contemplates and cultivates the five aggregates such as form as empty, impermanent, painful,

original: bdag med pa la sogs par rtog cing sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs par rtog cing sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: and selfless,

original: dngos po yod pa dang / mtshan ma can du dmigs shing bsgom pa'i phyir chos la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang / mtshan ma can du dmigs shing bsgom pa'i phyir chos la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: one observes and cultivates them as existent things and as having characteristics, so this is called craving for dharmas.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'i phyir mthun pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'i phyir mthun pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they are not mistaken about permanence, etc., they are called harmonious.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: The bodhisattva does not grasp any dharma as having characteristics,

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa'i rigs pa las dngos por chags shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa'i rigs pa las dngos por chags shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and because he is attached to things and grasps characteristics due to the rational practice of the three spheres being completely pure, it is a fault. This is the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The faults of the bodhisattva are of three kinds:

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: the perversion of view, the perversion of thought, and the perversion of recognition.

original: de la mngon par chags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon par chags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, attachment

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: indicates the perversion of view.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word abiding

original: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: indicates the perversion of thought.

original: 'du shes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word recognition

original: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa bstan to //🔽gal te gzugs 'di spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa bstan to // gal te gzugs 'di spang bar bya'o //
translated: indicates the perversion of recognition.🔽If one thinks, This form should be abandoned,

original: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba nas /🔽rnam par shes pa 'di spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba nas / rnam par shes pa 'di spang bar bya'o //
translated: and by this form should be abandoned,🔽up to This consciousness should be abandoned,

original: 'dis rnam par shes pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: 'dis rnam par shes pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: and by this consciousness should be abandoned,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po so sor phye ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po so sor phye ste /
translated: one is attached to the five aggregates of form, etc.,🔽as individual entities and as objects to be abandoned.

original: spang bar bya ba'i sgo nas mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i skyon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i sgo nas mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i skyon bstan pa ste /
translated: This indicates the fault of grasping at signs.

original: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This form should be abandoned🔽means that the bodhisattva who is abandoning

original: spong bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya @94a * //🔽ba'am / 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa 'dis /
analyzed: spong bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya @94a * // ba'am / 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa 'dis /
translated: thinks, This form should be abandoned by me,🔽or that form should be abandoned by this cultivation of the noble path.

original: gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault.🔽The same should be applied up to consciousness.🔽This suffering should be fully known up to

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: this path should be cultivated.🔽The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault.🔽This is taught in the following passage:🔽This suffering should be fully known,🔽this origination should be abandoned,

original: sdug bsngal 'di yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: this cessation should be realized,

original: lam 'di bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lam 'di bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and this path should be cultivated.🔽The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault with regard to the four noble truths.🔽It is taught that this suffering should be fully known up to🔽this path should be cultivated.🔽The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault.

original: 'dis lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: 'dis lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: This is taught in the following passage:🔽This suffering should be fully known,🔽this origination should be abandoned,🔽this cessation should be realized,🔽and this path should be cultivated.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la /
translated: The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault with regard to the four noble truths.🔽It is taught that this suffering should be fully known up to

original: sdug bsngal ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni shes par bya'o //
translated: this path should be cultivated.🔽The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault.🔽This is taught in the following passage:🔽This suffering should be fully known,

original: kun 'byung ba ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: this origination should be abandoned,

original: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: this cessation should be realized,🔽and this path should be cultivated.🔽The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault with regard to the four noble truths.🔽It is taught that this suffering should be fully known up to🔽this path should be cultivated.

original: lam ni bsgom par bya'o zhes 'byung ba la mtshan mar 'dzin pa skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni bsgom par bya'o zhes 'byung ba la mtshan mar 'dzin pa skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in the following passage:🔽This suffering should be fully known,🔽this origination should be abandoned,🔽this cessation should be realized,🔽and this path should be cultivated.🔽The apprehension of signs in this way is a fault with regard to the four noble truths.🔽It is taught that this suffering should be fully known

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is defilement.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is purification.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: This is the faultlessness of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.🔽This is a fault.

original: 'di ni skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bar chos de dag la mngon par chags shing gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bar chos de dag la mngon par chags shing gnas te /
translated: Thus, they become attached to those dharmas and abide in them, conceiving of them.

original: 'du shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste /
translated: This is the craving for agreeable dharmas of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: This is a fault.

original: chos rnams la blang ba dang / dor ba'i 'du shes dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa skyon du 'gyur ba bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: chos rnams la blang ba dang / dor ba'i 'du shes dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa skyon du 'gyur ba bstan pa ste ;
translated: Up to here, it has been shown that the conception of taking up and rejecting dharmas and apprehending signs is a fault.

original: de la 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therein, This is defilement means that it becomes the cause of saṃsāra such as attachment.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: This is purification” refers to the factors of enlightenment, such as the establishments of mindfulness, which are the causes of nirvana.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par lta ba dang / dad pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang mi 'gal ba rnams so //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par lta ba dang / dad pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang mi 'gal ba rnams so //
translated: “These dharmas should be practiced” refers to right view, faith, and so on, which are not in conflict with the bodhisattva’s conduct.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang / ma dad pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang 'gal ba rnams so //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang / ma dad pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang 'gal ba rnams so //
translated: “These dharmas should not be practiced” refers to wrong view, lack of faith, and so on, which are in conflict with the bodhisattva’s conduct.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Herein the bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice” refers to

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the perfections such as generosity.

original: 'di la spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Herein one should not practice” refers to

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'o//
translated: the opposites of generosity and so on, such as stinginess.

original: @94b 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @94b 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the path of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of path of the bodhisattva:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: On the first stage, the path of seeing is the correct realization of the pure realm of phenomena just as it is.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni chos kyi dbyings ji ltar rtogs pa de nyid sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang dang yang du goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni chos kyi dbyings ji ltar rtogs pa de nyid sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang dang yang du goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is the repeated cultivation of just that realization of the realm of phenomena on the second stage and so forth.

original: 'di ni lam ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni lam ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is not the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gong du smos pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gong du smos pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
translated: The adverse factors to the path of the bodhisattva mentioned above are

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bslab pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bslab pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the training of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The bodhisattva's training is threefold:

original: sdom pa'i bslab pa dang / dge ba'i chos la sogs pa'i bslab pa dang ; sems can gyi don byed pa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i bslab pa dang / dge ba'i chos la sogs pa'i bslab pa dang ; sems can gyi don byed pa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: the training in vows, the training in virtuous qualities, and the training in benefiting sentient beings.

original: 'di ni bslab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong ma las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bslab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong ma las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase this is not the training is the opposite of the above.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's perfection of generosity refers to

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin par byed pa'o//
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin par byed pa'o//
translated: giving with the three spheres completely pure.

original: 'di ni sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase this is not the perfection of generosity refers to

original: 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par sbyin pa byas pa ni sbyin pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par sbyin pa byas pa ni sbyin pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: giving with the three spheres completely impure, which is merely giving,

original: pha rol tu phyin par mi chud do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par mi chud do //
translated: but does not count as a perfection.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma lnga la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma lnga la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be applied to the remaining five perfections such as morality.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the skill in means of a bodhisattva great being.

original: don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs kyang /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs kyang /
translated: Although one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are empty,

original: kun rdzob tu bsdu ba rnam bzhi la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //🔽'di ni thabs mkhas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyan thos ltar zhi ba phyogs gcig la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bsdu ba rnam bzhi la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o // 'di ni thabs mkhas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyan thos ltar zhi ba phyogs gcig la gnas pa'am /
translated: one brings sentient beings to maturity through the four means of unification and so forth on the conventional level.🔽This is not skill in means.

original: so so'i skye bo ltar dngos po la chags nas 'khor ba la gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ltar dngos po la chags nas 'khor ba la gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the śrāvakas who abide in a one-sided peace, or like ordinary beings who abide in saṃsāra, attached to things.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the faultlessness of a bodhisattva great being.

original: skyon med pa'i mtshan nyid 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i mtshan nyid 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The defining characteristics of faultlessness will be explained below.

original: 'di ni skyon du 'gyur @95a * //🔽pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon du 'gyur @95a * // pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is a fault.

original: skyon gyi mtshan nyid gong du bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyon gyi mtshan nyid gong du bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The defining characteristics of faults have already been explained above.

original: de ltar chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon par chags te /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon par chags te /
translated: Thus, one grasps at the signs of phenomena and becomes attached to them.

original: 'du shes su byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes su byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The idea of a bodhisattva is a fault because it is an obscuration for a bodhisattva.🔽In the passage beginning with “In inner emptiness, he does not see outer emptiness,” etc.,

original: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'phags pa rab 'byor la /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'phags pa rab 'byor la /
translated: the noble Shariputra asks the noble Subhuti,🔽“What is the flawlessness of a bodhisattva?”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang yin zhes dris pa'i lan du /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang yin pa zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang yin zhes dris pa'i lan du / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang yin pa zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: In reply,

original: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In inner emptiness, he does not see outer emptiness,” etc.

original: nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pas phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid gzhan gyis stong par bya mi dgos te de bas na de stong par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pas phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid gzhan gyis stong par bya mi dgos te de bas na de stong par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Inner emptiness is empty of the intrinsic reality of inner emptiness, so it does not need to be emptied by another emptiness, such as outer emptiness.

original: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid btsal mi dgos pas /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid btsal mi dgos pas /
translated: Since it is not necessary to seek external emptiness in internal emptiness,

original: de la yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see it as real.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid bcva brgyad la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid bcva brgyad la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And so on for the eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: de ltar phyi nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po tha dad par mi lta bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig par rtogs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar phyi nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po tha dad par mi lta bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig par rtogs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the bodhisattva’s faultlessness is the realization that external and internal emptiness, etc., are not different things, but are of one taste in emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: they should train in the following way.

original: slob pa'i tshe ci nas kyang gzugs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i tshe ci nas kyang gzugs shes par bya ste /
translated: When training, they should know form,

original: gzugs des rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs des rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: but they should not be conceited about that form.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha.🔽One should not falsely project the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad po de dag gis rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kun rdzob tu so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa shes par byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad po de dag gis rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kun rdzob tu so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa shes par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having understood the conventional characteristics of the mundane dharmas such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., and the supramundane dharmas such as the perfection of generosity, etc.,

original: don dam par de dag gi mtshan nyid sems la mtshan mar 'dzin cing /
analyzed: don dam par de dag gi mtshan nyid sems la mtshan mar 'dzin cing /
translated: ultimately one should not grasp the characteristics of those in the mind as signs.

original: 'di'i @95b mtshan nyid ni 'di yin no snyam du sems la mi bsam mo zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i @95b mtshan nyid ni 'di yin no snyam du sems la mi bsam mo zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: One should not think in the mind, “The characteristic of this is this.”

original: de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi sems pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi sems pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just that non-grasping of signs and non-contemplation is the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub kyi sems des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: And one should not be proud of that thought of enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing rlom sems med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing rlom sems med pa /
translated: This is the explanation of the two, the non-apprehension of all dharmas as signs and the absence of pride,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no zhes ba shad pa de gnyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no zhes ba shad pa de gnyis /
translated: as the entrance into the flawlessness of the Bodhisattva.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
translated: And it is the cause of the attainment of supreme enlightenment, and so is called the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems yin no snyam mam /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems yin no snyam mam /
translated: One should not think, “This is the thought of enlightenment,”

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems yin no snyam mam /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems yin no snyam mam /
translated: or “This is the thought equal to the unequalled,”🔽or “This is the thought of greatness.”

original: rlabs po che'i sems yin no snyam du 'du shes mi skyed cing rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rlabs po che'i sems yin no snyam du 'du shes mi skyed cing rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: One should not think or be proud of it.

original: de ltar byas na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar byas na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement, “In that way, there is the entrance into the flawlessness of the Bodhisattva,” is this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar sems de sems ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de sems ma yin te /
translated: Because that thought is not a thought,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: because the nature of thought is clear light.

original: byang chub kyi sems la rlom sems su mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la rlom sems su mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The reason why one should not imagine the Thought of Enlightenment is taught.

original: sems de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The that Thought is

original: kun rdzob tu byang chub kyi sems zhes kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu byang chub kyi sems zhes kun brtags pa ste /
translated: the conventional designation Thought of Enlightenment.

original: don dam par rang bzhin yod par ma grub bas sems ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin yod par ma grub bas sems ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it is not established as having a nature ultimately, it is said it is not a thought.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the nature of the thought is clear light,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang / sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang / sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is clear light means that it is free from the stains of the conceptualization of subject and object, etc., and from obscurations.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba gang yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba gang yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is the clear light nature of the thought?

original: 'di ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: 'di ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: This is the clear light nature of the thought of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, Venerable Śāradvatīputra.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dri ma med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhib tu bstan pa ste /🔽sems gang 'dod chags dang yang mi ldan ma bral zhes bya ba ni sems kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de yi nas dag pa yin pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i tshe na yang /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dri ma med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhib tu bstan pa ste / sems gang 'dod chags dang yang mi ldan ma bral zhes bya ba ni sems kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de yi nas dag pa yin pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i tshe na yang /
translated: It is without the stains of subject and object, etc., and it is taught in detail that it is naturally radiant.🔽The mind is neither conjoined with nor disjoined from attachment, etc.🔽This is because the suchness of the mind, naturally radiant, is pure.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa /🔽'phags pa'i tshe na yang @96a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa / 'phags pa'i tshe na yang @96a * //
translated: Therefore, even in the state of ordinary beings, it is not conjoined with attachment, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And even in the state of āryas, it is not disjoined from attachment,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of suchness is unchanging.

original: de bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa lhag ma rnams dang mi ldan ma bral ba la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa lhag ma rnams dang mi ldan ma bral ba la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is neither conjoined with nor disjoined from the remaining such as delusion, etc.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gsum dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gsum dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of the three poisons, desire, hatred, and ignorance, as well as the latent states, the entanglements, and the views have already been explained.

original: sgrib pa dang gcod pa gnyis sngar bshad pas de gnyis da 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang gcod pa gnyis sngar bshad pas de gnyis da 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Obstructions and hindrances have already been explained, so they will not be explained here.

original: de la sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o /
translated: Obstructions are the obstructions to the knowable and the afflictions.

original: gcod pa zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gcod pa zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Hindrances are the five hindrances:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'phyar ba dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom  dang lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'phyar ba dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom  dang lnga ste /
translated: desire, hatred, sleepiness and drowsiness, excitement and remorse, and doubt.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid gnyis gcig tu bgrang /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid gnyis gcig tu bgrang /
translated: Sleepiness and drowsiness are counted as one.

original: 'phyar ba dang 'gyod pa gnyis gcig tu bgrang ngo //
analyzed: 'phyar ba dang 'gyod pa gnyis gcig tu bgrang ngo //
translated: Excitement and remorse are counted as one.

original: bar du gcod pa 'di lnga mya ngan las 'das pa la bar du gcod pa'i phyir gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa 'di lnga mya ngan las 'das pa la bar du gcod pa'i phyir gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These five hindrances are called hindrances because they hinder nirvana.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mi ldan ma bral zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mi ldan ma bral zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not endowed with, not separated from the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha thought” means

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dman pa dang mi ldan ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dman pa dang mi ldan ma bral ba'o //
translated: not endowed with, not separated from the inferior thought of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, is there a thought that is not a thought?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems gang la sems ma yin no zhes bya ba de yod dam zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems kyi rang bzhin ma grub na /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems gang la sems ma yin no zhes bya ba de yod dam zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems kyi rang bzhin ma grub na /
translated: This is Ārya Śāriputra’s question: “If the nature of a thought is not established ultimately,

original: sems ma yin no zhes bya ba yang dmigs su yod dam zhes 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma yin no zhes bya ba yang dmigs su yod dam zhes 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'o //
translated: is there a thought that is not a thought that can be observed?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar sems ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar sems ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is like that—there is no thought.🔽Is there an observation of existence or nonexistence in that which is not a thought, or is there existence?”

original: sems ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa dmigs pa'am yod par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sems ma yin no zhes bya ba de yod dam zhes bya ba'i tshig gzung ste /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa dmigs pa'am yod par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sems ma yin no zhes bya ba de yod dam zhes bya ba'i tshig gzung ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the words “Is there a thought that is not a thought?”

original: yod dam zhes bya ba nyid kyang don dam par mi 'thad pa'i phyir yod pa'am med pa don dam par dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: yod dam zhes bya ba nyid kyang don dam par mi 'thad pa'i phyir yod pa'am med pa don dam par dmigs pa'am /
translated: Also, existence is not tenable in the ultimate, so how could existence or nonexistence be observed or exist in the ultimate?

original: yod par 'gyur ram zhes rab 'byor gyis sh'a ri'i bu la slar dris pa'o //🔽smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa'am med pa zhes bya ba de yang /
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ram zhes rab 'byor gyis sh'a ri'i bu la slar dris pa'o // smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa'am med pa zhes bya ba de yang /
translated: Subhūti asks Śāriputra in return,

original: don dam par dmigs pa'am yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par dmigs pa'am yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Śāriputra says, Venerable Subhūti, it is not so. The meaning is that existence or nonexistence is not observed or existent in the ultimate.

original: gal te de ltar sems @96b ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs na /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod kyis de skad du /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sems @96b ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs na / tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod kyis de skad du /
translated: If it is not so, and existence or nonexistence is not found or observed in that non-mind,

original: sems gang la sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba de yod dam zhes phyir dris pa de 'thad par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems gang la sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba de yod dam zhes phyir dris pa de 'thad par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is it tenable for you to ask, Is that mind which is called non-mind existent or non-existent?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas te /
translated: Subhūti repeats the words of Śāradvatīputra,🔽and asks, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is it tenable for you to ask, Is that mind which is called non-mind existent or non-existent?

original: de ltar don dam par yod pa'am med pa mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par yod pa'am med pa mi dmigs na /
translated: Thus, if ultimate existence or non-existence is not perceived,

original: sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba yod dam zhes khyod kyis bdag la dris pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba yod dam zhes khyod kyis bdag la dris pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it is not logical for you to ask me, “Is there a mind that is not a mind?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems ma yin pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems ma yin pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, what is not a mind?”

original: don dam par sems kyi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i don gang yin pa dri ba las gleng bslang ste /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i don gang yin pa dri ba las gleng bslang ste /
translated: This is the introduction to the question, which is the meaning of the ultimate non-apprehension of the characteristic of mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain in detail the meaning of the changelessness and non-conceptuality of all phenomena such as form,

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'phags pa rab 'byor la dris pa'o //🔽sems ma yin pa ni 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'phags pa rab 'byor la dris pa'o // sems ma yin pa ni 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the noble Śāriputra asked the noble Subhūti.🔽“What is not a mind is changeless and non-conceptual.”

original: don dam par sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dam par sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because ultimately what is called “not a mind”

original: sems ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig gud na yod pa la mi bya'i /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa'i dngos po zhig gud na yod pa la mi bya'i /
translated: It is not that there is some other thing that is not mind.

original: sems kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: sems kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: The suchness of mind is natural luminosity.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par rnam par mi rtog cing mi sems la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par rnam par mi rtog cing mi sems la /
translated: It is not a thought that conceives of subject and object, and so on.

original: sems ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is called “not mind.”

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: That is the suchness of all phenomena.🔽It is called “inconceivable non-mind.”

original: de la ni sems med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i don nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la ni sems med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i don nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage clarifies the meaning of the above statement.

original: sems kyi de bzhin nyid mi 'gyur ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de ni /
analyzed: sems kyi de bzhin nyid mi 'gyur ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de ni /
translated: The suchness of mind, which is unchanging and naturally luminous,

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir /
translated: is the suchness and nature of all phenomena because they are inseparable.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is also the suchness of all phenomena.

original: rtog pa can gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa can gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not the domain of conceptual thought,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it is called “inconceivable.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽just as the mind is without change and without conceptualization,🔽are forms also without change and without conceptualization?

original: ji ltar sems la 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sems la 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Are feelings, perceptions, volitional factors, and consciousness also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the eyes also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are forms also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena also without change and without conceptualization?

original: gzugs la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Are the earth element also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the perfection of giving also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are inner emptiness also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the ten powers of the tathāgatas also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the buddhadharmas also without change and without conceptualization?🔽Are the knowledge of all aspects also without change and without conceptualization?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang 'gyur ba @97a * //🔽med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sems kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med par ro gcig pa dris pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang 'gyur ba @97a * // med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sems kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med par ro gcig pa dris pa'o //
translated: Are the knowledge of path aspects, knowledge of all aspects, and knowledge of all bases also without change and without conceptualization?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so, it is so.

original: ji ltar sems la 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ji ltar sems la 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Just as the mind is without change and without conceptualization, so also form is without change and without conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: And similarly, up to: the knowledge of all aspects is without change and without conceptualization.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'i lan /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'i lan /
translated: This is the reply to the question asked by the noble Śāriputra.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis btab pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis btab pa ste /
translated: It was given by the noble Subhūti.

original: 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba byin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don legs par bshad do
analyzed: 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don ni sngar bshad zin to // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba byin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i don legs par bshad do
translated: The meaning of “without change and without conceptualization” has already been explained.

original: zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra gave his approval to the venerable Subhūti, saying “Excellent!” and so on. This praises the excellent explanation of the meaning of the nature of all phenomena being without change and without conceptualization.

original: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sras thugs las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sras thugs las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You are called the Bhagavat’s heart-born son

original: thugs kyi rang bzhin zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi rang bzhin zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because you arise from the union of calm abiding and insight, which are the nature of his mind.🔽You are called “born from his mouth”

original: zhal nas byung ba zhes bya ba ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i chos bshad pa'i lung las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhal nas byung ba zhes bya ba ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i chos bshad pa'i lung las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because you arise from the scriptures, which are the speech of the one born from a face.

original: chos las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You are called “born from the Dharma”

original: bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin sgrub pa'i chos las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin sgrub pa'i chos las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because you arise from the Dharma of practice, which is the nature of reflection and meditation.🔽You are called “the emanation of the Dharma”

original: chos kyi sprul ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu zag pa med pa'i chos rtogs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sprul ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu zag pa med pa'i chos rtogs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zang zing gi bgo skal ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni ser sna spangs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos rnams la mngon sum gyi mig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi chos nyid las gzhan gyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rab 'byor gyis ji ltar zhib tu bstan pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In just this way, the bodhisattvas should also train in just this way.

analyzed: de ltar slob na tshul de las byang chub sems dpa' de phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If they train in this way, from this method it should be understood that those bodhisattvas are irreversible.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva great beings should be known as not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar spyod na byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang mthun par spyod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor nyan thos kyi sa la slong par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid nan tan du mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /

translated: This perfection of wisdom is indispensable for training in all of them.
