translated: It is beneficial for all.

original: kyis gzhan las legs par mnyan par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //🔽gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽mnyan pa'i tshig kha ton du lobs shing zin par bya'o //
analyzed: kyis gzhan las legs par mnyan par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o // gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni / mnyan pa'i tshig kha ton du lobs shing zin par bya'o //
translated: “One should listen with perseverance” teaches that one should listen well from others with the wisdom of listening.

original: bcad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should retain it” teaches that one should memorize the words of listening and master them.

original: lobs shing zin pa'i tshig dran pas phyi phyir ma brjed par bya'o //
analyzed: lobs shing zin pa'i tshig dran pas phyi phyir ma brjed par bya'o //
translated: “One should master it” teaches that one should not forget the words that one has memorized and mastered through mindfulness.

original: bklag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bklag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should read it” teaches that one should read the words that one has mastered.🔽“One should recite it” teaches that one should recite the words that one has read.

original: glegs bam du bris te yi dam du klog pa'o //
analyzed: glegs bam du bris te yi dam du klog pa'o //
translated: and having written it in a book, to read it as a tutelary deity.

original: yongs su chub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su chub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should fully understand it means

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ma lus par bsam pa'i shes rab kyis phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ma lus par bsam pa'i shes rab kyis phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: that one should fully understand and realize directly with the wisdom that contemplates the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should properly pay attention to it means

original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i don bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis yang dang yang du goms par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i don bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis yang dang yang du goms par bya ba'o //
translated: that one should repeatedly cultivate with the wisdom of meditation the meaning that one has understood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Why is that? and so forth indicate

original: de ltar shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis nan tan du bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis nan tan du bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: the reason for practicing in that way with the three types of wisdom.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis theg pa gang la bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum char shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis theg pa gang la bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum char shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the three vehicles, in which the hearers, solitary realizers, and bodhisattvas should train, are extensively taught in this perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes brtson pa'i phan yon mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes brtson pa'i phan yon mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: Having summarized the benefits of striving, this is taught.

original: 'di yan chad du brtson pa'i phan yon bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad du brtson pa'i phan yon bshad zin to //
translated: Up to this point, the benefits of striving have been explained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in a hundred thousand lines, called “Illuminating the Meaning.”

original: // / da ni brtson par bya ba'i dngos po du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni brtson par bya ba'i dngos po du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach the number of things to be striven for, the classification of striving will be explained.

original: brtson par bya ba rab tu dbye ba de yang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug 'og nas gzhung las bstan pa ste /
analyzed: brtson par bya ba rab tu dbye ba de yang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug 'og nas gzhung las bstan pa ste /
translated: That classification of what is to be striven for is the six types of practice of renunciation taught below in the text.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa dang / mi gnas par sgrub pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa dang / yongs su brtag pa'i sgrub pa dang / thabs la sgrub pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa dang / mi gnas par sgrub pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa dang / yongs su brtag pa'i sgrub pa dang / thabs la sgrub pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sgrub pa ste /
translated: The proof of freedom from the two extremes, the proof of non-abiding, the proof of non-appropriation, the proof of thorough analysis, the proof of means, and the proof of swift complete enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa 'di rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of these proofs, one is said to “depart” for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa de dag la brtson par bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa de dag la brtson par bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to open up the section that teaches the divisions of the one who should strive in those proofs of departure,

original: 'phags pa rab @98b 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma dmigs ma 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab @98b 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma dmigs ma 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: the noble Subhūti said to the Lord, “Thus, Lord, I do not apprehend and do not see the bodhisattva and the perfection of wisdom.”

original: don dam par brtson par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / brtson par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: don dam par brtson par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / brtson par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka yang mi dmigs na /
translated: If the bodhisattva who strives in the ultimate sense and the perfection of wisdom which is to be striven after are both non-apprehensible,

original: gang zag gang zhig chos gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gang zhig chos gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhe na /
translated: then what person should be instructed and edified in what dharma?

original: gong du brtson pa la gdams pa bshad pa'i tshig dang / don de nyid bzung ste zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gong du brtson pa la gdams pa bshad pa'i tshig dang / don de nyid bzung ste zhus pa'o //
translated: The above explanation of the instruction to strive and the meaning of that are taken up and asked about.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis chos thams cad 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs ma 'tshal bar zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis chos thams cad 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs ma 'tshal bar zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Bhagavan, in that way, I do not apprehend or see the increase or decrease of any dharma.🔽I would have regret up to

original: de nyid bdag gis 'gyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: de nyid bdag gis 'gyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du /
translated: I would be confused.

original: chos dang gang zag gnyi ga don dam par de ltar mi dmigs bzhin du /🔽byang chub sems dpa' zhe'am /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag gnyi ga don dam par de ltar mi dmigs bzhin du / byang chub sems dpa' zhe'am /
translated: Both the dharma and the person are not apprehended in that way in the ultimate sense.🔽If, having apprehended the bodhisattva and the perfection of wisdom as entities,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes dngos por dmigs te gdams par bgyis na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes dngos por dmigs te gdams par bgyis na /
translated: I were to instruct and edify,

original: dngos po med pa las sgro btags shing skyed pa dang / dngos po yod pa'i zlas med pa yang 'grub pas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las sgro btags shing skyed pa dang / dngos po yod pa'i zlas med pa yang 'grub pas /
translated: and it would be an imputation and production from a non-existent thing, and it would be an establishment as the non-existence of the counterpart of an existent thing.

original: skur pa btab par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: skur pa btab par yang 'gyur te /
translated: It would be a deprecation.

original: de ltar sgro btags shing skur pa btab par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar sgro btags shing skur pa btab par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if there were an imputation and a deprecation,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis la gnas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung dang 'gal ba'i phyir bdag gis 'gyod par 'gyur ro zhes gsol pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis la gnas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung dang 'gal ba'i phyir bdag gis 'gyod par 'gyur ro zhes gsol pa ste /
translated: since one would be abiding in the two extremes of existence and non-existence, I would regret it because it would contradict the scriptures of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po med pa las bskyed de sgro btags pa'o //🔽'grib pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu med pa ma yin pa las phri ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po med pa las bskyed de sgro btags pa'o // 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu med pa ma yin pa las phri ste /
translated: “Increase” means that ultimately it is an imputation, a production from a non-existent thing.

original: skur ba btab pa ste /
analyzed: skur ba btab pa ste /
translated: “Decrease” means that conventionally it is a deprecation, a subtraction from that which is not non-existent.🔽Thus, it is a deprecation.

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa dang ; skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa dang ; skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa ni /
translated: Not abiding in the two extremes of imputation and deprecation,

original: gang zag dang chos la yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: it is a teaching of the practice free from the two extremes of existence and non-existence of persons and phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: The Blessed One said, “That name also does not stand,

original: thug pa ma mchis /🔽byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis / byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'am /
translated: is not met with,🔽is not blessed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming de yang brjod par bya ba'i dngos por med pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming de yang brjod par bya ba'i dngos por med pas /
translated: ” And so on. The name “bodhisattva” or “perfection of wisdom” does not exist as a thing to be expressed.

original: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis spang ba bstan te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis spang ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches the abandonment of the two extremes of standing and not standing.

original: dngos po zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: dngos po zhig yod na ni /
translated: If something exists,

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos ltar yul dang @99a * //🔽phyogs na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos ltar yul dang @99a * // phyogs na gnas pa'am /
translated: like conditioned phenomena such as form and so on, it would stand in a place and direction.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa'i chos ltar yul dang phyogs na mi gnas par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa'i chos ltar yul dang phyogs na mi gnas par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or, like unconditioned phenomena such as space and so on, it would not stand in a place and direction.

original: ming de la dngos po med pas gnas pa yang med na /
analyzed: ming de la dngos po med pas gnas pa yang med na /
translated: But since that name does not exist as a thing, it does not stand,

original: mi gnas pa yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: and it is taught that it does not not stand.

original: thug pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Is not met with” means “does not not stand.”

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “There is no consecration” means

original: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa gnyis kyi mtha' spangs nas gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa'i dngos pos byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa gnyis kyi mtha' spangs nas gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa'i dngos pos byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: that, having abandoned the extremes of both abiding and not abiding, he is consecrated by the entity that neither abides nor does not abide.

original: gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “He does not abide” shows that.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis la dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i sgo nas sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis la dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i sgo nas sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming la gnas pa dang /
translated: Thus, with regard to both the bodhisattva and the perfection of wisdom, the extremes of superimposition and denial in terms of existence and non-existence of entity are abandoned, and the extremes of grasping at the name of the bodhisattva and the name of the perfection of wisdom as abiding and not abiding are abandoned.

original: mi gnas par 'dzin pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: mi gnas par 'dzin pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having briefly taught the practice free from the two extremes,🔽now, in order to teach the practice of the perfection of wisdom in detail, it is said:

original: da ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so sor phye ste /
analyzed: da ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so sor phye ste /
translated: Now, the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, the mundane and supramundane phenomena, and the conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are distinguished.

original: mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach in detail the practice free from the two extremes, having distinguished the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, and so on, the mundane and supramundane dharmas, and the conditioned and unconditioned dharmas,🔽[the Lord] says,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Blessed One, I do not apprehend the increase and decrease of form, I do not see it as real.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i don ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis yin no zhes sngar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i don ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis yin no zhes sngar bshad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of increase and decrease is the two extremes of superimposition and denial, as explained above.

original: des ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, he teaches the practice free from the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang la ming du gdags par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang la ming du gdags par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: What is the bodhisattva to whom the name is to be given? and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ming la gnas pa dang / mi gnas par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ming la gnas pa dang / mi gnas par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the practice free from the two extremes of conceiving of the name of form, etc. as abiding or not abiding.

original: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis su rtog pa dang bral ba'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis su rtog pa dang bral ba'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of being free from the two extremes of conceiving of abiding and non-abiding is as explained above.

original: ji ltar gzugs la mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'og ma thams cad @99b la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'og ma thams cad @99b la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the practice free from the two extremes with regard to form is explained, so it is to be applied to all the remaining such as feeling.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therein, the Blessed One, I do not apprehend the increase and decrease of form, nor do I see them.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa'i ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa'i ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: The name of consciousness, Blessed One, does not abide,

original: thug pa ma mchis /
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis /
translated: does not touch,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis te /
translated: is not empowered.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming de ma mchis pas de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pas de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: Because that name does not exist, thus that name does not abide,

original: thug pa ma mchis /
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis /
translated: does not touch,🔽is not empowered.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: up to “there is no consecration.”

original: phung po lnga'i 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis dang  bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan te /🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag gis mig gi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis dang  bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan te / bcom ldan 'das bdag gis mig gi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs /
translated: This teaches the practice that is free from the two extremes of increase and decrease, abiding and non-abiding of the five aggregates.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Blessed One, I do not apprehend or see the increase and decrease of the eye,

original: bcom ldan 'das yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: up to “Blessed One, the name of the mental consciousness does not abide,

original: thug pa ma mchis /
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis /
translated: does not meet,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis so //
translated: and is not consecrated.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming de ma mchis pas /
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pas /
translated: Because that name does not exist.

original: de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: Thus, that name does not abide,

original: thug pa ma mchis /
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis /
translated: does not meet,🔽and is not consecrated.”

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Up to here,

original: skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bcva brgyad kyi dngos po dang / ming la mtha' gnyis su rtog pa dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bcva brgyad kyi dngos po dang / ming la mtha' gnyis su rtog pa dang bral ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the establishment of the twelve sense spheres and the eighteen elements, and the freedom from the two extremes with regard to names.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Blessed One, I do not apprehend or see the increase or decrease of contact through the coming together of the eye.

original: bcom ldan 'das yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: Blessed One, the name of the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the coming together of the mind

original: thug pa ma mchis /
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis /
